For more information on compare and swap, and when you should opt out of comparison checks, refer to our docs. We encourage users to avoid opting-out unless it's justified by their use case.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 在庫管理のための新しい`changeFromQuantity`フィールド
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin GraphQL API 2026-01バージョンにて、在庫関連のミューテーションに`changeFromQuantity`フィールドが追加されました。このフィールドを使用することで、複数の更新が同時に発生する場合でも在庫データの正確性を保つことができ、期待する数量と実際の数量が一致しない場合はエラーを返して意図しない上書きを防ぎます。`inventoryAdjustQuantities`、`inventoryMoveQuantities`、`inventorySetOnHandQuantities`、`productVariantsBulkUpdate`の各ミューテーションで利用可能です。

gemini-2.5-flash.titleJa: 在庫管理のための新しい`changeFromQuantity`フィールド
gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: ShopifyのAdmin GraphQL APIに、在庫管理の同時実行性保護を強化する新しいオプションフィールド`changeFromQuantity`が追加されました。これにより、複数のシステムが同時に在庫を更新する際に、現在の在庫数と指定された値が一致しない場合に更新を失敗させ、データの正確性を保ち、意図しない上書きを防ぎます。主に在庫管理アプリや連携システムを開発するパートナーにとって、より堅牢な在庫更新ロジックを実装するために重要な機能です。

entries.title: Tax summary webhook `created_at` field now returns UTC timezone
entries.description:
What's new

The created_at field from tax_summaries/create webhook for tax partners will now return timestamps in UTC format with the Z suffix, including millisecond precision.

Action required

Update your parsing logic to handle the new format. The following are examples of the format prior to and after the change:

Versions prior to 2026-01:

{
  "id": 14,
  "shop_id": 1,
  "order_id": 7,
  "created_at": "2025-11-19T08:16:53-05:00",
  "summary": {
    ...
  }
}

Versions 2026-01 and higher.

{
  "id": 14,
  "shop_id": 1,
  "order_id": 7,
  "created_at": "2025-11-19T13:16:53.784Z",
  "summary": {
    ...
  }
}

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 税務サマリーWebhookの`created_at`フィールドがUTCタイムゾーンを返すように変更
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 税パートナー向けの`tax_summaries/create`ウェブフックにおいて、`created_at`フィールドのタイムスタンプ形式が変更されます。2026-01バージョン以降、タイムゾーン付き形式からUTC形式（Z接尾辞、ミリ秒精度付き）に変更されるため、このウェブフックを利用している場合はパース処理の更新が必要です。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: Shopifyの税務パートナー向けウェブフック`tax_summaries/create`において、`created_at`フィールドの時刻フォーマットが変更されます。APIバージョン2026-01以降、タイムスタンプがUTC形式（Zサフィックス付き）でミリ秒精度を含むようになります。この変更は既存のシステムに影響を与えるため、該当するウェブフックを処理しているパートナーは、日付解析ロジックの更新が必須です。

entries.title: Get to Shopify Support faster from the Shopify Help Center
entries.description:
Support update: we made it easier to chat with a human.

We heard you. After trying self‑serve, it wasn’t always clear how to reach a person.

What’s new: we’ve added a “Chat with a human” button on Help Center pages that puts you directly into the lineup for an advisor. On a typical day, we reach most contacts within 5 minutes.

Need support? Try it out on the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: ShopifyヘルプセンターからShopifyサポートへ素早くアクセス
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopifyヘルプセンターに「人間とチャット」ボタンが追加され、セルフサービスを試した後にサポート担当者へ直接連絡できるようになりました。通常、5分以内にサポート担当者が対応します。この改善により、マーチャントがより迅速に人的サポートを受けられるようになりました。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: Shopifyサポートが改善され、ヘルプセンターから人間とチャットで直接連絡を取りやすくなりました。セルフサービスで解決できない場合でも、ヘルプセンターのページに追加された「Chat with a human」ボタンから、通常5分以内にアドバイザーと繋がることが可能です。これにより、日本のマーチャントやパートナーは、より迅速にサポートを受けられるようになります。

entries.title: Deprecate `in_catalog` and `catalogs` fields from object type `Location`
entries.description:
The in_catalog and catalogs fields represents the legacy concept of direct connected catalogs to a location. Since the introduction of Markets Home this is not a valid concept anymore.

These fields are now deprecated and will be hidden from documentation starting in version 2026-04.

Developers who previously relied on these fields should update their integrations accordingly. No further action is required if these fields were not in use.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: `Location`オブジェクト型の`in_catalog`フィールドと`catalogs`フィールドの廃止
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin GraphQL APIのLocationオブジェクトから、`in_catalog`と`catalogs`フィールドが非推奨となり、2026-04バージョンからドキュメントに表示されなくなります。これらはMarkets Homeの導入により無効となった、ロケーションとカタログを直接接続する旧来の概念を表すフィールドです。これらのフィールドを使用している開発者は、統合の更新が必要です。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: ShopifyのAPIにおいて、`Location`オブジェクトタイプ内の`in_catalog`および`catalogs`フィールドが非推奨となります。これらは「Markets Home」の導入により不要となった古いカタログ連携の概念を表しており、2026年4月以降のAPIバージョンではドキュメントから削除されます。これらのフィールドを利用しているアプリや連携機能を持つパートナーは、システムの更新が必要です。

entries.title: Improved compare and swap inventory updates for the `inventorySetQuantities` mutation
entries.description:
This changelog relates to concurrency protection features.

We've enhanced the compare-and-swap functionality in the inventorySetQuantities mutation to make concurrent inventory updates more intuitive. You can now use the new changeFromQuantity field in InventoryQuantityInput to explicitly choose whether to perform quantity comparison checks.

The use of compareQuantity and ignoreCompareQuantity will be deprecated .

This 2026-01 change isn't considered breaking because if users don't pass in a value for changeFromQuantity, the mutation will fallback to using the values for compareQuantity and ignoreCompareQuantity.

How to use the field

Previously, to bypass comparison checks, you set ignoreCompareQuantity to true.

Now, to bypass comparison checks, you explicitly pass null to the changeFromQuantity field. To enable checks, pass an integer that represents the initial quantity before it is updated to the desired value.

Passing any value (including null) to changeFromQuantity will override any values passed to the compareQuantity and ignoreCompareQuantity fields. In the following example, the operation will only successfully set the new available quantity to 12 if the current available quantity is 5. If another process has modified the quantity in the meantime, you'll receive an error and can retry with the updated value.

  mutation {
    inventorySetQuantities(
      input: {
      quantities: [
        {
          quantity: 12,
          inventoryItemId: "gid://shopify/InventoryItem/2",
          locationId: "gid://shopify/Location/1",
          changeFromQuantity: 5
        }
      ],
      reason: "correction",
      name: "available"
    }
    ) {
      inventoryAdjustmentGroup {
        id
      }
      userErrors {
        code
        message
      }
    }
  }

Deprecating legacy fields

The compareQuantity and ignoreCompareQuantity fields will be deprecated in version 2026-01. We plan to remove them entirely starting from version 2026-04.

For more information on compare and swap, and when you should opt out of comparison checks, refer to our docs. We encourage users to avoid opting-out unless it's justified by their use-case.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: inventorySetQuantitiesミューテーションの比較交換による在庫更新機能の改善
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: inventorySetQuantitiesミューテーションの同時実行制御機能が強化され、新しいchangeFromQuantityフィールドが追加されました。これにより在庫数量の比較チェックをより直感的に制御できるようになります。従来のcompareQuantityとignoreCompareQuantityフィールドは2026-01で非推奨となり、2026-04で完全に削除される予定です。

gemini-2.5-flash.titleJa: `inventorySetQuantities` ミューテーションの在庫比較・交換更新機能の強化
gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: この変更は、Shopifyの在庫更新API（`inventorySetQuantities` ミューテーション）における同時更新時の排他制御メカニズムを改善するものです。新しい `changeFromQuantity` フィールドが導入され、開発者は在庫の比較・交換チェックをより直感的に制御できるようになります。既存の `compareQuantity` および `ignoreCompareQuantity` フィールドは2026-01バージョンで非推奨となり、2026-04バージョンで完全に削除される予定のため、APIを利用しているパートナーは将来的な対応が必要です。

entries.title: Apple Pay available as a payment method in Shop Pay checkout
entries.description: Merchants who have Apple Pay enabled as an express checkout option will now automatically have it enabled as a payment method in Shop Pay checkouts. Providing Apple Pay as a payment method expands your customer payment options while supporting your checkout customizations. Learn more about enabling Apple Pay.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: Shop Pay決済でApple Payが利用可能に
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Apple Payをエクスプレスチェックアウトとして有効にしているマーチャントは、Shop Payチェックアウトでも自動的にApple Payが決済手段として利用可能になりました。これにより、チェックアウトのカスタマイズを維持しながら、顧客の決済オプションが拡大されます。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: Apple Payをエクスプレスチェックアウトとして有効にしているマーチャントは、Shop Payのチェックアウト画面でも自動的にApple Payが支払い方法として利用可能になります。これにより、顧客はShop Pay利用時にもApple Payを選択できるようになり、支払いオプションが拡大し、チェックアウトの利便性が向上します。

entries.title: New Google Cloud Run deployment tutorial released
entries.description:
We're excited to introduce a new deployment tutorial for Google Cloud Run.

After scaffolding a Shopify app through the CLI and building out functionality in a local development store, what's next?

Deployment!

This tutorial guides you through the complete process of deploying your production Shopify apps, using Google Cloud Run as the target. You'll configure a project with the necessary permissions for continuous deployment, you'll set up a production database for persistent storage, and configure load balancing for multiple instances of your app across multiple regions.

Take a look and share your thoughts (including how you deploy your apps differently) on the Shopify community forum!

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: Google Cloud Run デプロイメントの新しいチュートリアルを公開
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: ShopifyアプリをGoogle Cloud Runにデプロイするための新しいチュートリアルが公開されました。このチュートリアルでは、継続的デプロイメントのための権限設定、本番用データベースの構築、複数リージョンでのロードバランシング設定など、本番環境へのデプロイプロセス全体を解説しています。CLIでアプリを構築した後の実運用に向けた重要なガイドとなります。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: ShopifyアプリをGoogle Cloud Runにデプロイするための新しいチュートリアルが公開されました。このガイドは、開発者がShopify CLIで作成したアプリを本番環境に展開する際、必要な権限設定、本番データベースの構築、複数リージョンでのロードバランシング構成までを網羅しています。これにより、日本のパートナーはより堅牢でスケーラブルなアプリを効率的にデプロイできるようになります。

entries.title: Sidekick Voice is now available in the Shopify Mobile App
entries.description:
Merchants can now use Sidekick Voice in the Shopify Mobile App. Sidekick Voice is context-aware and you can chat with Sidekick Voice as you navigate and work in the admin.

  • Voice conversations with Sidekick throughout the mobile admin
  • Persistent voice controls in navigation—mute and hang up buttons stay accessible during calls
  • Context-aware responses as Sidekick understands you're on mobile
  • Active conversations that continue as you move between tasks and screens until you end the call

Start a voice conversation with Sidekick using the voice button in the Sidekick panel. You can open the Sidekick panel using the Sidekick button in the bottom navigation bar. Voice controls appear in your navigation bar so you can mute, unmute, or hang up while continuing to work between different admin sections.

[Learn more]

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: Sidekick VoiceがShopifyモバイルアプリで利用可能になりました
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: ShopifyモバイルアプリでSidekickの音声機能が利用可能になりました。管理画面のどのページでもSidekickと音声で会話でき、画面を移動しても通話は継続され、ミュートや終了ボタンはナビゲーションバーから常にアクセス可能です。音声ボタンはSidekickパネル内にあり、コンテキストを理解した応答が得られます。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: Shopifyモバイルアプリで、AIアシスタント「Sidekick Voice」が利用可能になりました。これにより、マーチャントはモバイルアプリ内で音声でSidekickと会話しながら、管理画面の操作や情報取得ができるようになります。Sidekickはコンテキストを理解し、画面遷移中も会話が継続されるため、モバイルでのストア管理の効率化と利便性向上が期待されます。

entries.title: Enhanced AI image generation and editing on the Shopify mobile app
entries.description:
Turn any product photo on your mobile device into high quality pack shots and marketing images using natural language prompts.
* Crop and recenter
* Remove background content
* Change file names and alt text
* Use AI image generation to place products in various marketing shots

[Learn more]

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: Shopifyモバイルアプリで強化されたAI画像生成・編集機能
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopifyモバイルアプリで、AI画像生成・編集機能が強化されました。自然言語のプロンプトを使って、商品写真を高品質なパッケージショットやマーケティング画像に変換でき、背景削除、トリミング、再配置、ファイル名・代替テキストの変更などが可能です。AIを活用して商品を様々なマーケティングシーンに配置することもできます。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: Shopifyモバイルアプリで、AIを活用した画像生成と編集機能が強化されました。これにより、自然言語プロンプトを使って、モバイルデバイス上の商品写真を高品質な商品画像やマーケティング画像に変換できます。背景削除、トリミング、代替テキスト変更に加え、AIによる多様なマーケティングシーンへの商品配置が可能になり、マーチャントは商品画像の作成・編集をより手軽に行えるようになります。

entries.title: Shopify Dev MCP now supports POS UI extensions
entries.description:
The Shopify Dev MCP server now includes support for code generation for POS (Point of Sale) UI extensions.

With this update, you can use the Shopify Dev MCP as a virtual pair programmer within your preferred IDE. This enhancement allows you to:

  • Generate code snippets efficiently
  • Explore API capabilities seamlessly
  • Accelerate your development process across the Shopify platform

Get Started

If you're already using the Shopify Dev MCP server, support for POS UI extensions is automatically included in the latest version. If not, follow these steps to get started:

  1. Configure the Shopify Dev MCP server to integrate it with your development environment.
  2. Unlock the new capabilities by ensuring your setup is up-to-date.

By following these steps, you can take full advantage of the new features and enhance your development workflow.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: Shopify Dev MCPがPOS UI拡張機能に対応
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Dev MCPサーバーが、POS（販売時点管理）UI拡張機能のコード生成に対応しました。これにより、開発者は好みのIDE内でコードスニペットの生成やAPI機能の探索が可能になり、POS向けアプリ開発を効率化できます。既存ユーザーは最新版に自動的に含まれ、新規ユーザーはセットアップが必要です。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: Shopify Dev MCPサーバーがPOS (Point of Sale) UI拡張機能のコード生成に対応しました。これにより、開発者はIDE内で仮想ペアプログラマーとしてDev MCPを活用し、POSアプリ開発を効率化できます。コードスニペットの生成やAPI探索が容易になり、開発プロセスが加速するため、より高品質なPOSアプリの提供に繋がります。

entries.title: Resource IDs in tax webhook summary section and calculation requests migrate to Global IDs
entries.description:
Tax Partner Apps now receive consistent identifiers that match Shopify's GraphQL Admin API. Starting with API version 2026-01, these apps will receive Global IDs (GIDs) for customers, products, line items, and sales agreements, aligning with Shopify's standard guidance for using Global IDs across all APIs.

This change makes the tax calculation API consistent with how partners interact with other Shopify APIs, using the same identifier format throughout the platform. Tax service providers can now use the same IDs they receive from other Shopify endpoints, eliminating the need to manage different ID formats for tax-specific integrations.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 税金Webhookサマリーセクションと計算リクエストのリソースIDがグローバルIDに移行
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2026-01以降のAPIバージョンから、Tax Partner Apps（税金計算連携アプリ）で使用されるリソースIDが、既存の数値形式からShopifyのGraphQL Admin APIと統一されたグlobal ID（GID）形式に変更されます。これにより、顧客、商品、ラインアイテム、販売契約などのIDがShopifyの他のAPIと同じ形式で提供されるようになり、税金連携における開発がシンプルになります。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: Shopifyの税金計算パートナーアプリにおいて、APIバージョン2026-01以降、顧客、商品、ラインアイテムなどのIDがGlobal ID (GID) に統一されます。これにより、税金計算APIが他のShopify APIと一貫性を持つようになり、パートナーは異なるID形式を管理する必要がなくなります。日本の税金サービスプロバイダーや開発者は、この変更に対応することで、より効率的な連携が可能になります。

entries.title: Released delegatable billing permissions
entries.description:
Delegatable billing allows merchants to grant specific team members permission to view invoices, manage payment methods, and handle billing-related information—without elevating them to full account ownership.

This feature is available for merchants within an organization. Permissions can be delegated directly in the Shopify Admin under Settings > Users and permissions.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 委任可能な請求権限をリリース
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 組織アカウントを持つマーチャント向けに、請求書の閲覧や支払い方法の管理などの請求関連権限を、アカウントオーナー権限を付与せずに特定のチームメンバーに委譲できる機能がリリースされました。この権限設定は、Shopify管理画面の「設定」>「ユーザーと権限」から直接行うことができます。日本のマーチャントにとっては、経理担当者などに適切な権限を安全に付与できるようになり、チーム運営の効率化が期待できます。

gemini-2.5-flash.summarizedJa: Shopifyは、マーチャントが特定のチームメンバーに対し、請求書の閲覧や支払い方法の管理といった請求関連の権限を、アカウント全体の所有権を与えることなく委任できる機能をリリースしました。この機能は「組織」に属するマーチャントが利用でき、Shopify管理画面の「設定 > ユーザーと権限」から設定可能です。これにより、経理担当者などがより安全に請求情報を管理できるようになります。

entries.title: Tax liability changes for Facebook & Instagram sales channel orders
entries.description:
Starting August 26, 2025, Meta (Facebook & Instagram) is no longer acting as a marketplace facilitator for orders placed through the Facebook & Instagram sales channel. This means that merchants are now responsible for tax collection and filing on these orders, rather than Meta handling tax obligations.

What's changed:
- Orders placed on or after August 26, 2025 through Facebook & Instagram will show channel_liable: false in your order data

What stays the same:
- Orders placed before August 26, 2025 remain Meta's responsibility for tax filing (channel_liable: true)
- No changes to your Facebook & Instagram sales channel setup

Resource links:
- Shopify Tax documentation
- Facebook & Instagram sales channel documentation

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: FacebookとInstagramの販売チャネル注文における税金処理の変更
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2025年8月26日より、Facebook & Instagram販売チャネル経由の注文について、Metaがマーケットプレイスファシリテーターとしての役割を終了し、税金の徴収と申告の責任がマーチャント側に移管されます。この日以降の注文では注文データの`channel_liable`が`false`となり、マーチャント自身が税務処理を行う必要があります。この変更はFacebook & Instagramチャネルを利用している全てのマーチャントに影響します。

entries.title: Protected customer data scopes required for web pixel PII access starting on December 10th
entries.description:
We will be enforcing Shopify's protected customer data policy for all web pixel extensions starting on December 10th, 2025. Customer personally identifiable information (PII)—including name, email, phone, and address fields—will only be present in web pixel payloads when the app has been approved for the corresponding protected scopes.

What’s changing

  • Web pixel payloads will be filtered at runtime based on the app’s approved access scopes.
  • If your app is not approved for a given scope, the corresponding fields in the pixel event will be set to null. Event data structure remains stable.
  • Enforcement applies on all web pixel surfaces: storefront, checkout, and customer accounts.
  • Custom pixels are out of scope for this change.

Protected scopes enforced

  • read_customer_name
  • read_customer_email
  • read_customer_phone
  • read_customer_address
  • read_customer_personal_data

Example

{
  "event": "checkout_completed",
  "customer": {
    "email": null,           // null if not approved for read_customer_email
    "first_name": null,      // null if not approved for read_customer_name
    "phone": null            // null if not approved for read_customer_phone
  },
  "shipping_address": {
     "first_name": null,	// null if not approved for read_customer_name
     "address_1": null, 	// null if not approved for read_customer_address
     "address_2": null, 	// null if not approved for read_customer_address
     "zip": null,      	// null if not approved for read_customer_address
     "phone": null            // null if not approved for read_customer_phone
     [other address fields exempt]
  }
}

Non-PII data events will continue to fire normally. Your analytics, conversion tracking, and non-PII use cases will not be affected.

What you need to do

  • Review and request access. Ensure you have approval for the protected scopes you require. See Protected Customer Data Policy. You should only request the scopes your app uses.
  • Update your code paths. Handle null for gated fields without breaking event handling or analytics pipelines.
  • Test across surfaces. Verify behavior on storefront, checkout, and customer accounts. No downtime is expected.

This change will take effect starting on December 10th, 2025. We recommend submitting your request for protected customer data review as soon as possible if you need to maintain access to these values.

No action is needed if your app is already approved for protected customer data, or is resilient to null values. If you have questions about this change, please comment on this post in the Developer Community forums.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 12月10日より、Webピクセルが個人情報にアクセスする際に保護された顧客データスコープが必須となります
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2025年12月10日より、Web Pixel拡張機能で顧客の個人情報（氏名、メール、電話番号、住所）にアクセスするには、対応する保護スコープの承認が必須となります。承認されていない場合、ピクセルイベント内の該当フィールドはnullとなるため、アプリ開発者は必要なスコープの申請とコード対応が必要です。非PII（個人識別情報以外）のデータには影響ありません。

entries.title: Tax webhook summary and calculation requests now use Global IDs
entries.description:
Starting with API version 2026-01, third-party tax apps will receive Global IDs (GIDs) in tax calculation requests and tax summary webhook payloads for all entity references of the summary section. This aligns with how Partners interact with other Shopify APIs.

These apps can now use the same identifiers across all Shopify endpoints without managing different ID formats for tax-specific integrations.

What's changed

This change affects two key integration points:

Tax calculation requests:

  • Customer, Company, CompanyLocation, Product, and ProductVariant IDs now use the GID format.

Tax summary webhooks:

  • All entity IDs within the summary section (Order, Customer, Product, ProductVariant, SalesAgreement, Sale, LineItem, Company, CompanyLocation ShippingLine, and TaxLine) now use the GID format.
  • The webhook payload also includes new admin_graphql_api_id fields at the top level for TaxSummary, Shop, and Order entities.

Changes include:

  • Top Level: Adds shop_admin_graphql_api_id and order_admin_graphql_api_id fields (existing shop_id and order_id remain as integers).
  • Customer IDs: Changes from "id": "5" to "id": "gid://shopify/Customer/5".
  • Product IDs: Changes from "id": "1" to "id": "gid://shopify/Product/1".
  • Product Variant IDs: Changes from "id": "1" to "id": "gid://shopify/ProductVariant/1".
  • Line Item IDs: Changes from "line_item_id": "5" to "line_item_id": "gid://shopify/LineItem/5".
  • Sale IDs: Changes from "id": "9" to "id": "gid://shopify/Sale/9".
  • Agreement IDs: Changes from "id": "6" to "id": "gid://shopify/Agreement/6".
  • Company IDs: Changes from "id": "3" to "id": "gid://shopify/Company/3".
  • Company Location IDs: Changes from "id": "4" to "id": "gid://shopify/CompanyLocation/4".
  • Shipping Line IDs: Changes from "id": "4" to "id": "gid://shopify/ShippingLine/4".
  • Tax Line IDs: Changes from "id": 6 to "id": "gid://shopify/TaxLine/6".

What you need to do

Update your integrations to handle the GID format when processing tax calculations and webhook payloads in API version 2026-01 and later. The following are some examples:

Tax calculation request

Before (2025-10 and earlier): 

{
  "cart": {
    "buyer_identity": {
      "customer": {
        "id": "593934299"
      }
    }
  }
}

After (2026-01):

{
  "cart": {
    "buyer_identity": {
      "customer": {
        "id": "gid://shopify/Customer/593934299"
      }
    }
  }
}

Tax summary webhook

Before (2025-10 and earlier):

{
  "id": 80,
  "shop_id": 1,
  "order_id": 64,
  "summary": {
    "agreements": [{
      "id": "82",
      "sales": [{
        "id": "106",
        "line_item_id": "76"
      }]
    }]
  }
}

After (2026-01):

{
  "id": 80,
  "admin_graphql_api_id": "gid://shopify/TaxSummary/80",
  "shop_id": 1,
  "shop_admin_graphql_api_id": "gid://shopify/Shop/1",
  "order_id": 64,
  "order_admin_graphql_api_id": "gid://shopify/Order/64",
  "summary": {
    "agreements": [{
      "id": "gid://shopify/SalesAgreement/82",
      "sales": [{
        "id": "gid://shopify/Sale/106",
        "line_item_id": "gid://shopify/LineItem/76"
      }]
    }]
  }
}

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 税金Webhookサマリーと計算リクエストでグローバルIDを使用開始
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2026-01 APIバージョンから、サードパーティ税計算アプリが受け取るtax calculation requestとtax summary webhookのペイロード内のエンティティIDが、整数形式からGlobal ID（GID）形式に変更されます。Customer、Product、Order、LineItemなど全てのエンティティ参照が「gid://shopify/EntityType/ID」形式になるため、税計算アプリを開発しているパートナーは2026-01までに対応が必須です。

entries.title: Duplicate user groups to speed up setup
entries.description:
You can now duplicate user groups instead of rebuilding them from scratch.

Open any user group, click the actions menu at the top right, and select "Duplicate". All the roles and store assignments copy over to a new group instantly. Rename it, adjust what you need, and save.

Available only on Plus plans. Learn more in Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: ユーザーグループを複製してセットアップを高速化
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Plusプランにおいて、ユーザーグループを複製できる機能が追加されました。既存のグループを開き、アクションメニューから「複製」を選択すると、役割とストアの割り当てが新しいグループに即座にコピーされ、名前の変更や必要な調整を行って保存できます。これにより、類似したユーザーグループをゼロから構築する手間が大幅に削減されます。

entries.title: Cash checks on the go with Shopify Balance.
entries.description:
We’ve released Add Checks for Shopify Balance users in the US. This update helps merchants who receive paper checks easily cash them into their Shopify Balance account without leaving the Shopify app. With Add Checks, merchants can capture both sides of a check using their phone camera, confirm the deposit amount, and submit instantly for review. The feature is now available to all eligible Balance accounts.

To learn more, visit our Help Center guide on depositing checks in Shopify Balance.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: Shopify Balanceで外出先から小切手を換金
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Balance（米国向け金融サービス）に、紙の小切手を入金できる「Add Checks」機能が追加されました。マーチャントはスマートフォンのカメラで小切手の両面を撮影し、金額を確認して即座に入金申請ができます。この機能は米国内の対象Balance口座で利用可能です。

entries.title: Pay US Suppliers Instantly with Same-Day ACH from Shopify Balance
entries.description: We’ve released Same-Day ACH for eligible Shopify Balance users in the US. Merchants can now pay suppliers, contractors, or vendors directly from their Balance account and have the funds reach them on the same business day. This upgrade reduces waiting times tied to traditional bank transfers and ensures payments land quickly, helping merchants maintain trust and smooth supply chain operations.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: Shopify Balanceの即日ACH送金で米国サプライヤーへ即座に支払い
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 米国のShopify Balanceユーザー向けに、同日ACH送金機能がリリースされました。この機能により、マーチャントはサプライヤーや業者への支払いを当日中に完了でき、従来の銀行振込の待ち時間を削減し、サプライチェーンの円滑な運営をサポートします。現時点では米国限定の機能となっています。

entries.title: Capital flex is now live in the US
entries.description:
Shopify Capital has introduced Capital flex, a new funding option that gives you continuous access to working capital — with a dynamic limit that adjusts as your business grows. Draw funds whenever you need them, and as you repay, your available capacity automatically replenishes.
No more over-borrowing upfront or waiting until 51% repayment to access additional capital.

With Capital flex, you get:
* Funding exactly when you need it
* A dynamic limit that grows with your business
* Fees only on the amount you draw
* One-time application with ongoing access — no need to re-apply for future draws
* Control to repay faster to save on fees, or slower to preserve cash flow.

Learn more about Capital flex with Shopify Capital in the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 米国でCapital flexの提供を開始しました
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Capitalに新しい融資オプション「Capital flex」が米国で提供開始されました。これは事業成長に合わせて利用限度額が動的に調整され、必要な時に資金を引き出し、返済すると自動的に利用可能枠が回復する仕組みです。51%返済を待たずに追加資金にアクセスでき、引き出した金額にのみ手数料が発生し、一度の申請で継続的に利用できます。

entries.title: Exclude products by tag in smart collections
entries.description:
You can now use an “is not equal to” operator for product tags when setting smart collection conditions, automatically leaving out products with specific tags.

Use it to refine themed collections, omit recalled items, or exclude select products from promotions alongside other rules.

Learn more about this update in help docs.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: スマートコレクションでタグによる商品の除外
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: スマートコレクションの条件設定で、商品タグに「等しくない」演算子が使用できるようになり、特定のタグを持つ商品を自動的に除外できるようになりました。テーマ別コレクションの絞り込み、リコール商品の除外、プロモーションから特定商品を除外するなど、より柔軟なコレクション管理が可能になります。

entries.title: New: Collection duplication
entries.description:
You can now duplicate any collection to create an exact copy—including its title, description, image, conditions, and manual product list so you no longer have to rebuild them from scratch.

When you duplicate a collection, we keep the copy unpublished so you can review and edit before going live.

Learn more about this update in help docs.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 新機能：コレクションの複製
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopifyでコレクションを複製できる新機能が追加されました。タイトル、説明、画像、条件設定、手動で追加した商品リストなど、すべての要素を含む完全なコピーが作成でき、ゼロから再構築する必要がなくなります。複製されたコレクションは非公開状態で作成されるため、公開前に内容を確認・編集できます。

entries.title: Carrier Service API now includes order totals and customer tags
entries.description:
The Carrier Service API callback payload has been enhanced to include order totals and customer tags. This update allows you to calculate shipping rates more effectively by considering the order value and customer segments.

New Payload Fields:

  • order_totals
    • subtotal_price: The total price of items before discounts and taxes.
    • total_price: The final price after applying discounts and taxes.
    • discount_amount: The total amount of discounts applied to the order.
  • customer
    • id: The unique identifier for the customer.
    • tags: Labels associated with the customer, useful for segmentation.

These new fields are automatically included in all callback responses, enabling you to tailor shipping rates based on detailed order and customer information. For more information on how to implement these changes, please refer to the Carrier Service API documentation.

Consider updating your shipping rate calculations to leverage these new fields for a more customized shipping experience.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: キャリアサービスAPIに注文合計と顧客タグを追加
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Carrier Service APIのコールバックペイロードに、注文合計金額（割引前・割引後・割引額）と顧客タグ情報が追加されました。これにより、注文金額や顧客セグメントに基づいて、より柔軟で詳細な配送料金の計算が可能になります。この機能は自動的にすべてのコールバックレスポンスに含まれます。

entries.title: tax_summaries/create webhook and taxSummaryCreate mutation now available
entries.description:
As of the 2026-01 API version, the tax_summaries/create webhook and taxSummaryCreate mutation are available for Tax Partner Apps.

What's New

The taxSummaryCreate mutation enables apps to request the generation of tax summaries for orders. The tax_summaries/create webhook is triggered by events that may affect tax liability, such as fulfillments and refunds.

Using the Mutation

The mutation accepts either a specific order ID or a time range for bulk processing:

mutation {
  taxSummaryCreate(orderId: "gid://shopify/Order/123456789") {
    enqueuedOrders {
      id
    }
    userErrors {
      field
      message
    }
  }
}

Webhook Payload

The tax_summaries/create webhook provides comprehensive tax data, including:

  • Sales agreements and associated sales details
  • Delivery groups with fulfillment information
  • Tax exemption details
  • Return sales types for refund workflows
  • Order context and financial status

Requirements

  • Access Scope: write_taxes
  • Tax Platform Access: Tax Platform features

Learn More

For information about the Tax Platform and partnership opportunities, see Building tax apps.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: tax_summaries/create webhook と taxSummaryCreate ミューテーションが利用可能になりました
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2026-01 APIバージョンから、税務パートナーアプリ向けに`tax_summaries/create` webhookと`taxSummaryCreate` mutationが利用可能になります。これにより、注文の税金サマリーを生成したり、フルフィルメントや返金など税務に影響するイベントを受け取ることができるようになります。利用には`write_taxes`スコープとTax Platform機能へのアクセスが必要です。

entries.title: Receive weekly store order summary in your inbox
entries.description:
Weekly store order summary gives you a new way to stay updated on your order activity. Each week, you'll receive an email with key metrics like total sales, orders, sessions, and conversion rate. The email also includes links to your analytics dashboard so you can dive deeper into your data.

If you have order and store management permissions, you can turn this on in your notification settings for yourself and your staff members.

To get started, go to Settings > Notifications > Staff notifications and toggle on the weekly store order summary.

Learn more about order notifications in the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 店舗注文の週次サマリーをメールで受信
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 毎週、ストアの注文サマリーをメールで受け取れる新機能が追加されました。総売上、注文数、セッション数、コンバージョン率などの主要指標が含まれ、分析ダッシュボードへのリンクも提供されます。設定 > 通知 > スタッフ通知から、自分やスタッフメンバーに対してこの機能を有効化できます。

entries.title: Order Update Phone Field Public
entries.description:
As of Admin API 2026-01, the phone field is now publicly available in the orderUpdate mutation's OrderInput. This field allows developers to update the customer phone number for an order, overwriting the existing phone number.

This change brings parity with the REST API, which already supports updating the phone field through the Order resource. The phone field is particularly useful for maintaining accurate customer contact information, especially for SMS notifications and order-related communications.

For implementation details, refer to the orderUpdate mutation documentation.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 注文更新の電話番号フィールドを公開
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin API 2026-01から、GraphQLのorderUpdateミューテーションで注文の電話番号フィールド（phone）が更新可能になりました。これによりREST APIと同等の機能が提供され、SMS通知など顧客連絡先情報の管理が容易になります。既存の電話番号を上書きする形で更新が可能です。

entries.title: Create cards for additional accounts within Balance
entries.description:
We’ve added the ability to create cards for additional accounts within Balance in an improved Cards section. Now merchants with Balance can spend directly from their additional accounts using cards. Merchants with Credit and/or Balance can also create and manage their own and other staff cards in the new Cards section.
To learn more, visit our Help Center on Balance cards.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Balanceで追加アカウント用のカードを作成できる機能が追加されました。マーチャントは追加アカウントから直接カードで支払いができるようになり、改善されたカードセクションでスタッフカードの作成・管理も可能になります。Balance CreditまたはBalanceを利用しているマーチャントが対象です。

entries.title: Legacy custom apps can’t be created after January 1, 2026
entries.description:
Update:
Starting January 1, 2026, you can no longer create new custom apps in the Shopify admin. This affects merchants and developers who create custom apps directly from the admin. Existing custom apps aren’t affected and will continue to work. To create a new custom app after this date, use the Dev Dashboard to build the app, then install it on your store. This change improves security and long‑term support for custom apps.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2026年1月1日以降、Shopify管理画面から従来型のカスタムアプリを新規作成できなくなります。既存のカスタムアプリは引き続き動作しますが、新規作成する場合はDev Dashboardを使用する必要があります。この変更はセキュリティと長期サポートの向上を目的としています。

entries.title: New Queries for Bulk Operations
entries.description:
We've introduced new GraphQL queries to help you retrieve and manage bulk operations in the Admin API.

What's Changed

Here's an overview of the updates:

New Bulk Operations Retrieval Queries

We have added two new queries for accessing your bulk operations:

  • bulkOperations: A connection-based query that returns a paginated list of all your bulk operations, complete with filtering and sorting options.
  • bulkOperation: A single-object query that retrieves a specific bulk operation by its ID.

Enhanced Filtering and Search Capabilities

The bulkOperations connection now supports flexible querying with the following features:

  • Status Filtering: Locate operations by status (e.g., canceled, completed, running).
  • Type Filtering: Filter operations by type (query or mutation).
  • Date Filtering: Search for operations created before or after a specific date.
  • Sorting Options: Sort operations by created_at, completed_at, or status in ascending or descending order.
  • Search Syntax: Use field:value patterns for precise filtering.

What You Need to Do

Depending on your requirements, follow these steps:

To List and Filter Bulk Operations

Utilize the bulkOperations connection query with search syntax:

query {
  bulkOperations(
    first: 10
    query: "status:completed operation_type:query created_at:>2025-10-10"
    sortKey: CREATED_AT
    reverse: true
  ) {
    edges {
      node {
        id
        status
        query
        createdAt
        completedAt
        url
      }
    }
    pageInfo {
      hasNextPage
      hasPreviousPage
    }
  }
}

To Retrieve a Specific Bulk Operation

Use the bulkOperation query:

query {
  bulkOperation(id: "gid://shopify/BulkOperation/123456789") {
    id
    status
    query
    createdAt
    completedAt
    url
    errorCode
  }
}

If You're Using Existing Bulk Operation Workflows

No changes are necessary. The currentBulkOperation can still be used but is being deprecated.

Why We Made This Change

Previously, you could only access the most recent bulk operation through currentBulkOperation. These new queries offer:

  • Complete visibility into all your bulk operations, not just the current one.
  • Enhanced debugging capabilities by filtering operations by status or date.
  • Efficient pagination for managing large numbers of operations.
  • Simplified monitoring, debugging, and management of bulk operations at scale.

Learn More

  • Bulk Operations Queries Guide

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin GraphQL APIに、バルクオペレーション（大量データの一括処理）を取得・管理するための新しいクエリが追加されました。従来は最新の操作のみアクセス可能でしたが、新しい`bulkOperations`と`bulkOperation`クエリにより、全ての操作履歴の取得、ステータス・日付・種類での絞り込み、並び替えが可能になります。既存の`currentBulkOperation`は非推奨となりますが、現在の実装への影響はありません。

entries.title: Faster Invoice Payment Confirmation for Indian Merchants
entries.description:
We've improved the invoice payment experience for merchants in India. When you pay an invoice, you'll now be redirected directly to your payment provider to complete authentication, reducing payment confirmation time from over 30 hours to around 30 seconds. 🚀

Previously, you needed to wait for a notification from your bank, then navigate to your banking portal separately to enter your OTP and complete payment. Now, you'll get a notification from Razorpay and be redirected immediately to complete authentication in one seamless flow. Your payment will be confirmed within seconds.

This update applies to all manual invoice payments in your Shopify admin and is available to all merchants in India.

Learn more about the new payment flow in the Shopify Help Center

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: インド加盟店向け請求書支払い確認の迅速化
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: インド市場のマーチャント向けに、請求書の支払い確認プロセスが大幅に改善されました。支払い時に決済プロバイダー(Razorpay)へ直接リダイレクトされ、認証を完了できるようになったことで、従来30時間以上かかっていた支払い確認時間が約30秒に短縮されます。この変更はインドの全マーチャントのShopify管理画面での手動請求書支払いに適用されます。

entries.title: Sidekick data visualization and export updates
entries.description:
We've added the ability for Sidekick to create chart visualizations, make spreadsheet exports of analytics queries, and have added sidekick to the segmentation code editor.

Now you can visualize your analytics queries with bar, line, and donut charts and export and download reports to CSV, JSONL, XML, or Parquet. You can also access sidekick directly in the segmentation code editor to create customer segments with natural language.

Learn more about Sidekick capabilities in the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Sidekickにデータビジュアライゼーションとエクスポート機能が追加されました。分析クエリを棒グラフ、折れ線グラフ、ドーナツグラフで可視化でき、レポートをCSV、JSONL、XML、Parquet形式でダウンロード可能になりました。また、セグメンテーションコードエディタでSidekickを直接利用し、自然言語で顧客セグメントを作成できるようになりました。

entries.title: Shopify Duties and Import Taxes: US Section 232 tariff customization
entries.description:
The United States applies additional tariffs on all HTSUS codes that represent products that may contain steel and aluminum, depending on the amount of metal in the product. By default, US Customs and Border Control will assume these products contain 100% metal unless it is specified differently on the commercial invoice.

Previously, our duties and import tax calculations in checkout applied the same default - assume those products contain 100% metal. Now, duties and import taxes supports customizing the percentages of your product's value that Section 232 steel and aluminum tariffs apply to.

This new setting applies to all items in your store that fall under Section 232. To customize this amount, visit your admin's duty settings and enter the percentage in "United States Section 232 percentage".

To ensure you also recieve a reduced rate when shipping your orders, ensure you also update your commercial invoices to reflect your product's proportion of metal.

You can learn more about collecting duties and import taxes at checkout on the help center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 米国向け越境ECにおいて、鉄鋼・アルミニウムを含む製品に対するSection 232関税の計算方法がカスタマイズ可能になりました。従来は製品の金属含有率を100%と仮定して関税計算されていましたが、管理画面の設定で実際の金属含有率の割合を指定することで、より正確な関税額を算出できるようになります。米国への輸出時には商業送り状にも同じ割合を記載する必要があります。

entries.title: Control search engine indexing for your shop.app storefront
entries.description:
Starting today, by default your shop.app storefront can be indexed by search engines like Google and Bing. This means customers searching for products like yours can discover your Shop storefront through organic search results, helping you reach new audiences and drive sales.

You can control this in your Shop channel settings.

Learn more about managing search engine indexing for shop.app in the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: shop.appストアフロントがGoogleやBingなどの検索エンジンにデフォルトでインデックスされるようになりました。これにより、オーガニック検索からの新規顧客獲得が可能になります。Shopチャネル設定から検索エンジンのインデックス登録を制御できます。

entries.title: Shop now uses the Shopify Catalog
entries.description:
The Shop app is now powered by the Shopify Catalog. This means that the Shop app, along with other AI-powered shopping experiences, makes all of your active online store products discoverable. Here's how it works:

  • Products you've published to Shop will be available for direct sale within the Shop app
  • All your other active online store products will be discoverable in the Shop app, but customers will visit your online store product page to check out

For more information on managing your presence on the Shop app, visit the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: ShopアプリがShopify Catalogを使用するようになり、オンラインストアのすべてのアクティブ商品が検索可能になりました。Shopチャネルに公開した商品はShopアプリ内で直接販売され、その他のアクティブ商品はShopアプリで発見された後、マーチャントのオンラインストアで購入される仕組みです。

entries.title: Flow: Cancel in-progress workflow runs
entries.description:
You can now cancel workflow runs while they're in progress, either while they are executing a wait step, or when they are retrying due to an error.

Because workflow runs can retry automatically for up to 36 hours after a transient error is encountered, before this update you could not rerun your workflow until the retries stopped. Now you can take control and cancel these runs immediately.

For any run that’s currently in progress, you can cancel workflow runs on the workflow run details page. You can also cancel one or more runs from the “Recent runs” section on the workflow’s summary page. In addition, when you turn off a workflow, it will now cancel in progress runs.

Once cancelled, you can rerun the workflow with any fixes made to your workflow. This gives you faster feedback loops when building and testing automations, and ensures failures don't block your workflow development.

For more information about building templates, visit the documentation. For questions and feedback, visit the Shopify community.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Flowで実行中のワークフローを手動でキャンセルできるようになりました。待機ステップの実行中やエラーによる再試行中にキャンセル可能で、ワークフローをオフにした際も進行中の実行が自動的にキャンセルされます。これにより、最大36時間続く自動再試行を待たずに修正したワークフローを即座に再実行できるため、自動化の構築とテストのサイクルが大幅に高速化されます。

entries.title: Filter out bot traffic in your sessions related reports
entries.description:
You can now filter between human and bot traffic in your Shopify Analytics reports, giving you clearer insights into actual customer behavior.

What's new:
* “Human or Bot session” filter separates real customers from automated traffic
* “Human or Bot session” dimension to drill down into human or bot specific patterns
* More accurate metrics by focusing on genuine visitor behavior

Get clearer conversion rates, identify which referral sources bring real customers, and measure true store performance without bot traffic skewing your data.

How to use it:
Open any Shopify Analytics sessions report and use the "Human or bot session" filter to focus on the traffic type most relevant to your analysis. Filter to "Human" to see your customer conversion rates, or view both to understand your complete traffic composition. Or, add it as a dimension to analyze the differences.

Coming soon:
Support for headless and Hydrogen stores
Enhanced classification as the system continues learning from traffic patterns

Learn more

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Analyticsのセッション関連レポートで、ボットトラフィックと人間のトラフィックを分離できるフィルター機能が追加されました。「Human or Bot session」フィルターと分析軸により、実際の顧客行動のみに焦点を当てた正確なコンバージョン率や流入元の分析が可能になり、ボットによるデータの歪みを排除できます。今後、ヘッドレスおよびHydrogenストアにも対応予定です。

entries.title: Set compare-at prices in Catalogs
entries.description:
You can now set and edit compare-at prices directly in Catalogs, giving you complete control over strikethrough pricing without complex CSV uploads or API calls. When you adjust product prices, the system preserves your existing compare-at values, preventing any accidental removal of compare-at prices.

You can use the View As feature to preview exactly how your pricing and discounts will appear to customers in different markets before you publish.

Learn more about configuring catalogs in help docs.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: カタログ機能内で比較価格（打消し線価格）を直接設定・編集できるようになりました。これにより、複雑なCSVアップロードやAPI呼び出しなしで、市場ごとの割引表示を完全にコントロールできます。また、商品価格を調整しても既存の比較価格が保持され、誤って削除される心配がなく、公開前に「View As」機能で異なる市場での価格表示をプレビューできます。

entries.title: Test orders no longer sync to Avalara Tax Compliance
entries.description:
Merchants using Avalara Tax Compliance will no longer see test orders (orders created using a test payment gateway) appear in their Avalara AvaTax dashboard or reports. This change ensures that only production order data is synced to Avalara Tax Compliance for tax calculation and reporting purposes.

If your business workflows require test orders to be visible in Avalara AvaTax for validation or testing purposes, please contact Shopify Support.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Avalara Tax Complianceを利用しているマーチャントにおいて、テスト決済ゲートウェイで作成されたテスト注文が、Avalara AvaTaxのダッシュボードやレポートに同期されなくなりました。この変更により、本番環境の注文データのみが税金計算およびレポート目的でAvalaraに同期されるようになります。テスト注文の同期が必要な場合は、Shopifyサポートへの連絡が必要です。

entries.title: Optional location inputs for inventory transfers
entries.description:
You can now create inventory transfers without specifying an origin or destination location.

Previously, the InventoryTransferCreateAsReadyToShip mutation required both origin and destination location IDs.

Now, these inputs are optional. This change supports workflows where the transfer's origin or destination is unknown at creation time.

Note: You must provide at least one of origin or location as input to validate the mutation.

Example:

mutation OmitOriginExample {
  inventoryTransferCreateAsReadyToShip(
    input: {
      lineItems: [
        { inventoryItemId: "gid://shopify/InventoryItem/...", quantity: 5 }
      ]
      originLocationId: null,
      destinationLocationId: "gid://shopify/Location/...",
    }
  ) {
    inventoryTransfer {
      id
      status
      origin { name }
      destination { name }
    }
  }
}

What you need to do

Nothing.

This isn't a breaking change. No action is required. Existing apps that provide IDs for inventory transfer origins or destinations will continue to function correctly. If your app previously required these fields, then you can update your validation logic to treat them as optional.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin GraphQL APIの在庫転送作成ミューテーション（InventoryTransferCreateAsReadyToShip）において、出荷元ロケーションと出荷先ロケーションの指定がオプショナルになりました。従来は両方の指定が必須でしたが、転送作成時に出荷元または出荷先が不明な場合のワークフローに対応するため、少なくとも一方のロケーションを指定すれば良くなりました。既存アプリへの影響はなく、破壊的変更ではありません。

entries.title: Built for Shopify apps get priority visibility across the Shopify App Store
entries.description:
Built for Shopify (BFS) apps are now featured more prominently across key App Store surfaces, helping merchants discover them faster.

What's new:

  • Homepage spotlight: BFS now appears in the featured header section of the App Store homepage, giving certified apps maximum exposure to browsing merchants.
  • Priority recommendations: BFS apps receive preferential positioning on some category pages.
  • Interactive BFS badge: All BFS badges across the App Store are now clickable to provide merchant education on BFS standards.

These enhancements work alongside existing Built for Shopify benefits including ranking boosts and the BFS search filter, making Built for Shopify the most effective way to maximize your app’s visibility and discovery potential in the App Store.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Built for Shopify認定アプリが、Shopifyアプリストアのホームページヘッダーやカテゴリーページで優先的に表示されるようになりました。BFSバッジがクリック可能になり、マーチャントへの認定基準の説明が強化され、アプリの発見性が大幅に向上します。これにより、BFS認定を取得することがアプリの露出を最大化する最も効果的な方法となります。

entries.title: The `cartDiscountCodeUpdate` mutation now requires the `discountCodes` field
entries.description:
As part of the GraphQL Storefront API 2026-01 release, the cartDiscountCodesUpdate mutation now requires the discountCodes agrument to be included. Previously, the cartDiscountCodesUpdate mutation would accept a mutation with no discountCodes argument, which would not actually modify the cart in any way.

For more information about the Cart object and its related mutations, visit Shopify.dev.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Storefront GraphQL API 2026-01版から、`cartDiscountCodesUpdate`ミューテーションで`discountCodes`引数が必須となりました。従来はこの引数なしでもミューテーションが実行できましたが、実際にはカートに変更を加えないため、今後は必須パラメータとして明示的な指定が求められます。カスタムストアフロントやヘッドレスコマースでこのAPIを使用している場合は、コードの修正が必要です。

entries.title: New ACH support for deferred payments
entries.description:
The 2026-01 Admin GraphQL API introduces support for ACH payment methods, enabling merchants to accept and manage bank account-based payments through Shopify Payments. This means new types of PaymentInstrument and CustomerPaymentInstrument are now available for B2B company locations, supporting payment terms and draft orders. If your integration manages the payment lifecycle of those ways to sell, consider upgrading. If you are not on the latest version of the API, you will not find these available payment methods.

New Objects:

  • BankAccount - Represents a bank account payment instrument

Updated Types:

  • PaymentInstrument union - Now includes BankAccount
  • CustomerPaymentInstrument union - Now includes BankAccount

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2026-01 Admin GraphQL APIでACH（銀行口座）決済のサポートが追加されました。Shopify PaymentsでB2B取引における銀行口座ベースの決済を受け付けることができるようになり、PaymentInstrumentとCustomerPaymentInstrumentにBankAccountタイプが追加されています。B2Bの支払条件や下書き注文の決済ライフサイクルを管理する統合機能を持つ場合は、最新APIバージョンへのアップグレードを検討する必要があります。

entries.title: Shopify Payments France gets new payment methods
entries.description:
What's new:
Klarna, Bancontact, iDEAL, BLIK, Przelewy24, TWINT, EPS, and MobilePay are available to merchants using Shopify Payments in France.¹

Why it's great:
* More checkout options for local and international buyers
* Your payouts are in one place
* Automated dispute resolution in your admin

How it looks in Payouts:
You may see more than one Shopify Payments payout entry per day when using these methods.

Visit your Payments Settings to enable new payment methods or learn more in our Help Centre.

We’re continuing to add more payment methods to give you and your customers more choice at checkout.

*1. Payment methods are subject to eligibility requirements.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: フランスのShopify Paymentsで、Klarna、Bancontact、iDEAL、BLIK、Przelewy24、TWINT、EPS、MobilePayの8つの決済方法が新たに利用可能になりました。これにより、フランスのマーチャントは現地および海外の購入者により多くの決済オプションを提供でき、支払いは一元管理され、自動紛争解決機能も利用できます。日本のマーチャントには直接的な影響はありませんが、越境ECでフランス市場を対象とする場合に参考になる情報です。

entries.title: New `notify` parameter available on the `storeCreditAccountCredit` mutation
entries.description:
The storeCreditAccountCredit mutation now includes an optional notify parameter.

  • When this parameter is set to true, the account owner will receive a "store credit issued" email notification. If the parameter is not provided, no email will be sent. To enable email notifications, you must explicitly set this flag to true.

  • For store credit accounts owned by a Customer, the email will be sent to the customer's default email address.

  • For store credit accounts owned by a CompanyLocation, each customer associated as a CompanyContact for that company location will receive an email at their respective default email address.

For more details refer to the storeCreditAccountCredit mutation in the developer documentation.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin GraphQL APIの`storeCreditAccountCredit`ミューテーションに、新たに`notify`パラメータが追加されました。このパラメータを`true`に設定することで、ストアクレジット付与時に顧客へメール通知を送信できるようになります。顧客アカウントまたは企業ロケーション配下の担当者に対して、それぞれのデフォルトメールアドレスへ通知が送られます。

entries.title: Quick count extension in Shopify POS
entries.description:
With the new quick count extension in Shopify POS, you can now update your on hand inventory right from your POS app. Use your device’s built-in camera, a connected barcode scanner, or search for products by name—making the inventory process faster and less prone to errors.

Quick count lets you adjust up to 1,000 products per counting session, and all updates sync in real time with your Shopify Admin. Your staff can keep inventory accurate to avoid stockouts or overstocks—without ever leaving the POS environment.

Learn more about the quick count POS extension

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify POSに新しいクイックカウント機能が追加され、POSアプリから直接在庫数を更新できるようになりました。デバイスのカメラ、バーコードスキャナー、商品名検索を使用して、1セッションあたり最大1,000商品の在庫調整が可能で、すべての更新はShopify管理画面とリアルタイムで同期されます。店舗スタッフがPOS環境を離れることなく正確な在庫管理を行い、欠品や過剰在庫を防ぐことができます。

entries.title: ACH bank payments for B2B
entries.description:
U.S. merchants can now accept ACH direct debit bank payments through Shopify Payments for B2B orders. This payment method is available to customers with U.S. bank accounts.

Your wholesale customers can pay directly from their bank accounts at checkout and save their payment details for future orders. Once saved, you can charge their accounts directly from the admin as payments become due, eliminating manual payment matching.

Activate ACH bank payments in your Shopify Payments settings or learn more in the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 米国のマーチャントがShopify PaymentsでB2B注文に対してACH口座振替による銀行決済を受け付けられるようになりました。卸売顧客は米国の銀行口座から直接支払いができ、支払い情報を保存して今後の注文に利用できるほか、マーチャントは管理画面から直接顧客の口座に請求できるようになります。この機能は米国の銀行口座を持つ顧客のみが利用可能です。

entries.title: New reporting will give you insights into cross border sales profitability
entries.description:
New reports called “Average profit margin by market” and “Profit margin by order” have been introduced to Shopify’s Reporting Platform.

“Average profit margin by market” helps you understand how much profit you’re earning, per market. It also helps you understand the costs your customers pay for orders, and any extra costs that you incur to fulfill them.

This new report is broken down per Market. When viewing the report, you can click a market’s name to drill-down to another report, “Profit margin by order”. This shows you the same metrics on an individual order basis, so you can get a detailed view of your profitability.

To visit this feature, open your admin and navigate to Analytics -> Reporting.
Then, search for “Average profit margin by market”.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopifyのレポート機能に「マーケット別平均利益率」と「注文別利益率」の2つの新しいレポートが追加されました。これにより、越境EC販売における各マーケットごとの収益性、顧客の支払コスト、フルフィルメントにかかる追加コストなどを詳細に分析できるようになります。管理画面の「分析」→「レポート」から利用可能です。

entries.title: Updated online store promotion app store requirement
entries.description:
Effective Wednesday, November 5th, 2025, the following requirement for the online store has been revised:

  • Your app must not use theme app extensions or blocks to promote your app, promote related apps, or request reviews.

  • App Name Branding in theme extensions is now permitted only under specific conditions: when customers directly interact with branded elements as a key aspect of their buying experience, or when removing these elements would cause confusion or harm to customers. In all other cases, the standard attribution pattern must be used.

  • Your app may use App Name Branding in theme extensions only if one or both of the following criteria are met:

    • Customers directly interact with the custom branding elements as a key aspect of their buying experience, such as part of a payment method or loyalty program.
    • Removing the custom branding elements would cause confusion or harm to customers.

App Name Branding includes:

  • Company or app logos, icons, branded watermarks, visual identifiers, or other branded imagery.
  • Company or app name displayed as text in any form, including plain text, branded fonts, or stylized lettering.
  • Custom design elements containing the name or logo of the company or app.

Standard app attribution: If your app does not meet the criteria above for App Name Branding, you must use the standard app attribution pattern. This pattern is limited to a 24x24 pixel width and height for any image or text.

Regardless of branding, all apps must not:

  • Request app reviews or ratings
  • Promote other apps or services

You can find this revised requirement in the online store section of the checklist of requirements page.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2025年11月5日より、Shopifyアプリストアのオンラインストア要件が更新され、テーマアプリ拡張機能でのアプリ宣伝やレビュー依頼が禁止されます。アプリ名やロゴのブランディング表示は、決済方法やロイヤルティプログラムなど顧客体験に不可欠な場合のみ許可され、それ以外は24x24ピクセルの標準アトリビューション表示のみが認められます。

entries.title: POS UI extensions: Developer experience Improvements
entries.description:
We’ve released a major update to POS UI extensions, aimed at reducing friction and speeding up your workflow.

Key improvements include:

  • Hot reloading improvements: We've made hot reloading faster and smoother. Code changes appear on your POS test device instantly without flickering. This update also supports reloading entire navigation screens, so you no longer need to exit and re-enter a screen to see your changes.
  • POS dev console: When you scan your deeplink, you are immediately directed to the POS dev console where you view your app and extension information. The console offers easy access to targets and configurations, centralizing everything you need to efficiently build your extension.
  • Quick target previews: With the new "Preview" feature in the dev console, you can instantly jump to the correct screen in the POS app where your extension is rendered.
  • Build error reporting: If your extension code triggers an error, you’ll now see an error UI directly on the POS device. Tapping the broken component opens the dev console with information about the extension and the error.
  • App persistence: You can configure your extension to automatically reconnect after a POS restart, removing the need to deep link repeatedly.
  • In-app reset: You can remove your extension without restarting the POS or your dev server, making it easy to test new deep links quickly.

Ready to get started? All you need is POS v10.13+ and Shopify CLI v3.85+. Find everything you need in our documentation.

We're excited to hear how this improves your workflow! Let us know what you think in our developer community.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify POS UI拡張機能の開発者体験が大幅に改善されました。ホットリロードの高速化、POS開発コンソールの追加、エラーレポート機能、自動再接続機能など、開発ワークフローを効率化する機能が実装されています。利用にはPOS v10.13以上とShopify CLI v3.85以上が必要です。

entries.title: New: Unlisted product status
entries.description:
We’ve introduced a new product status called “Unlisted”. It hides products from store search and collections, all sales channels, internet searches and Shopify Catalog—while still allowing access via a direct URL. It’s ideal for private sales, warranties, add-ons, or “free gift with purchase” items you don’t want discovered or used outside of their intended purpose.

Learn more about Unlisted product status in help docs.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopifyに新しい商品ステータス「非公開(Unlisted)」が追加されました。この機能により、商品を検索結果やコレクション、販売チャネルから非表示にしつつ、直接URLでのアクセスは可能にできます。プライベートセールや保証品、購入特典など、特定の用途でのみ利用したい商品の管理に最適です。

entries.title: Accept more local payment methods
entries.description:
We’ve added Pay by link to Shopify POS payments so you can now accept iDeal, Klarna, Swish, Twint, Mobilepay and USDC in your retail stores. Now you can activate these local payment methods in Shopify Payments and let customers pay on their own device with a secure QR code or link. This helps you expand your checkout options and reduces the need for manual entry.

To get started, update your Shopify POS app to version 10.13 and enable your payment provider in your payment methods available in your region in Shopify Admin > Point of Sale > Settings

Visit the Help Center to learn more.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify POSに「Pay by link」機能が追加され、実店舗でiDeal、Klarna、Swish、Twint、Mobilepay、USDCなどの地域別決済手段を受け付けられるようになりました。顧客は自分のデバイスでQRコードまたはリンクを使って安全に支払いができ、手動入力の手間が削減されます。利用するにはPOSアプリをバージョン10.13にアップデートし、管理画面の設定で決済手段を有効化する必要があります。

entries.title: Increased limits in metafield and metaobject definitions
entries.description:
We've increased the limits for metafield and metaobject definitions, providing you with more flexibility when building custom data structures for your apps and stores.

  • For app developers: Each app has its own allocation, so apps aren't competing with each other for definition space.
  • For merchants: Higher limits support complex workflows across multiple apps and meet custom data needs.
  • For metaobject entries: The 1,000,000 entry limit per definition removes previous plan-based restrictions of 64,000 (non-Plus) and 128,000 (Plus).

With these new limits, you can:

  • Create more granular data structures in your apps.
  • Support larger catalogs and content libraries.
  • Build apps with richer metadata without worrying about hitting limits.

Changes to metaobject definitions

App definitions

  • Each app installed on a shop can create up to 256 metaobject definitions

Merchant definitions

  • 128 definitions for Basic, Shopify, and Advanced plans
  • 256 definitions for Plus and Enterprise plans

Metaobject entries

  • Up to 1,000,000 entries per definition

Changes to metafield definitions

App definitions

  • Each app can create up to 256 definitions per resource type

Merchant definitions

  • 256 definitions per resource type

Note: Standard metaobject and metafield definitions do not count towards these limits.

Learn more

  • Metaobject limits
  • Metafield limits
  • Metaobjects overview
  • Metafields overview

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: メタフィールドとメタオブジェクトの定義数の上限が大幅に引き上げられました。アプリ開発者は各アプリごとに最大256個の定義を作成でき、メタオブジェクトのエントリー数は定義あたり100万件まで拡張されました。これにより、複雑なカスタムデータ構造の構築や大規模カタログの管理が可能になり、マーチャントとパートナーの双方により柔軟なデータ活用が実現します。

entries.title: Improved concurrency handling in the Cart AJAX API and Storefront Cart GraphQL API
entries.description:
As of October 10, 2025, the Cart AJAX API and Storefront Cart GQL API now processes simultaneous requests. For example, when sending two cart add requests at the same time, the Cart AJAX API executes both requests.

Previously, the Cart AJAX and GraphQL APIs were inconsistent in handling concurrent requests. This sometimes resulted in requests being dropped.

This is considered a bug fix for both APIs, but may require updates if the theme or storefront is unintentionally sending duplicate requests.

Note: If too many simultaneous requests are receieved, the Cart AJAX API will instead return an HTTP 409 response, while the Storefront Cart GraphQL API will return an error with code "CONFLICT" and message "Could not complete cart operation. The cart conflicted with another request".

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2025年10月10日より、Cart AJAX APIとStorefront Cart GraphQL APIが同時リクエストを適切に処理できるようになりました。以前は同時リクエストの処理が不安定でリクエストが失われることがありましたが、バグ修正により両方のリクエストが実行されるようになります。ただし、テーマやストアフロントが意図せず重複リクエストを送信している場合は修正が必要になる可能性があります。

entries.title: Support metafield and metaobject standards in Declarative Custom Data Definitions
entries.description:
We now support enabling and referencing standard metafield and metaobject definitions through an app’s TOML file. Key benefits include:

  • Standard metafield and metaobject definitions can be enabled through TOML, and managed through the app dev or app deploy command.
  • Shopify automatically distributes these definitions to multiple shops simultaneously, significantly speeding up migration processes.
  • Updates are atomic, ensuring that all stores consistently maintain the same version of your definitions.

For more information, see the custom data documentation on shopify.dev.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: アプリのTOMLファイルを通じて、標準のメタフィールドおよびメタオブジェクト定義を有効化・参照できるようになりました。これにより、複数のストアへの定義の一括配布が可能になり、移行プロセスが大幅に高速化されます。また、アトミックな更新により全ストアで定義のバージョンが一貫性を保つことができます。

entries.title: Shop channel updates: Shoppable videos and posts migration
entries.description:
Update: We've removed shoppable videos and shoppable posts from Shop product pages and Shop Stores as of October 15th, 2025. This change is part of our migration to a new web-based platform that will improve buyer discovery and shopping experiences.

For shoppable videos, your content will continue to be discoverable in Shop's home feed where it reaches more potential shoppers. Videos will return to product pages and Shop Stores soon with enhanced discovery features.

For shoppable posts, this functionality has been discontinued to focus our Shop Minis platform on buyer-first discovery experiences that drive more sales for merchants. Some shoppable post providers may become available as new standalone Shop Minis in the future.

Your main Shopify store and other sales channels are not affected by these changes, and shoppers can still complete purchases normally through Shop.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2025年10月15日より、Shopチャネルの商品ページとShop Storesから、ショッパブル動画とショッパブル投稿が削除されました。ショッパブル動画はShopのホームフィードで引き続き表示され、今後機能強化された形で商品ページに戻る予定です。ショッパブル投稿機能は廃止され、Shop Minisプラットフォームでの購入体験に注力する方針となっています。

entries.title: We’ve increased the product variant limit to 2048
entries.description:
It’s now possible to create products with up to 2,048 variants in Shopify, a significant increase from our long-standing limit of 100 variants per product. This means you can showcase more of your product catalog and drive higher conversion with a more diverse product offering.

Everything related to setting up products and their variants in Shopify admin has stayed the same, simply log in to the Products section of admin to get started.

Learn more about 2048 variants in help docs and in our blog.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopifyの1商品あたりのバリエーション数の上限が、従来の100から2,048に大幅に引き上げられました。これにより、サイズや色など多様な組み合わせを持つ商品を1つの商品ページで管理・販売できるようになり、より充実した商品ラインナップの提供が可能になります。管理画面での設定方法は従来と同じで、追加の対応は不要です。

entries.title: The product variant limit is now 2048 for all merchants
entries.description:
It is now possible for all Shopify merchants to create products with up to 2,048 variants in Shopify, exceeding our historical variant limit of 100.

Please note that merchants using apps that are not using the in-support GraphQL product APIs may have a downgraded or broken experience when creating or viewing products with more than 100 variants.

Learn more about 2048 variants, including information on migrating from REST product APIs to the in-support GraphQL product APIs, in our developer docs.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: すべてのShopifyマーチャントで、商品バリエーション数の上限が従来の100から2,048に拡張されました。ただし、旧式のREST APIを使用しているアプリでは、100を超えるバリエーションを持つ商品の作成・表示時に機能が制限されたり、正常に動作しない可能性があります。開発者は最新のGraphQL商品APIへの移行が推奨されています。

entries.title: Introducing the Shop Minis SDK (early access)
entries.description:
Shop Minis offer immersive, full-screen buyer experiences within the Shop app. These experiences are built using familiar web technologies, leveraging our React SDK to streamline development. The Shop Minis SDK is now available for early access, enabling you to build and launch your Minis quickly and efficiently.

To create a new Mini, run the following command in your terminal. This will set up a new project with the latest version of the Shop Minis SDK:

npm init @shopify/shop-mini@latest

For more information on the SDK and available development commands, visit our documentation: Shop Minis API Documentation

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shop Minis SDKがアーリーアクセスとして提供開始されました。これはShopアプリ内でフルスクリーンの没入型購買体験を構築できる機能で、ReactとWeb技術を使用して開発できます。npm経由で簡単にプロジェクトを作成し、迅速にMiniアプリを構築・公開することが可能です。

entries.title: Subscriptions now available in POS
entries.description:
You can now sell subscriptions in-store with Shopify POS using the Shopify Subscriptions app. This brings the same subscription options you offer online into your retail stores, so customers can start recurring purchases no matter where they shop.

With this update, staff can add subscription products directly at checkout in POS. Buyers can subscribe in-store to the same plans available online, helping you drive repeat revenue and build lasting customer relationships.

For developers, build custom subscription experiences using new properties added to the Cart API and LineItem interface. Learn more about API and extension updates in the developer changelog.

Subscriptions on POS are available to all merchants using the Shopify Subscription app. Learn more about setup in the Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify POSでサブスクリプション販売が可能になりました。Shopify Subscriptionsアプリを使用することで、オンラインと同じサブスクリプションプランを実店舗でも提供でき、スタッフはPOSのチェックアウト時に直接サブスクリプション商品を追加できます。開発者向けには、Cart APIとLineItemインターフェースに新しいプロパティが追加され、カスタムのサブスクリプション体験を構築できるようになりました。

entries.title: Refund screen for returns & exchanges
entries.description:
Retail staff now have a dedicated refunds screen during the return and exchange checkout, designed to improve accuracy and revenue retention in the refund process.

With this new screen, staff are no longer defaulted to the original payment method for refunds. Instead, they are presented with revenue-retaining options such as issuing a gift card or store credit directly from the refund flow. This screen also allows staff to accurately direct refunds or gift cards to the correct recipient—crucial for preventing errors like refunding to the original buyer instead of the intended recipient, especially for gifted orders.

With this update:

  • Staff can more easily promote revenue-retaining options to buyers, instead of always refunding to the original payment method.
  • Misdirected refunds—such as accidentally issuing refunds to the original buyer’s credit card or sending digital gift cards to the wrong email due to pre-populated fields—are eliminated.

Learn more about processing refunds in POS.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify POSの返品・交換処理に専用の返金画面が追加されました。この機能により、店舗スタッフは元の決済方法への返金だけでなく、ギフトカードやストアクレジットなど売上を維持できる選択肢を簡単に提示できるようになり、ギフト商品の返金先を間違えるなどのエラーも防止できます。実店舗を運営するマーチャントにとって、返金処理の正確性向上と収益保持に役立つアップデートです。

entries.title: Subscription Selling Plan support with POS UI Extensions
entries.description:
POS UI Extensions 2025-10 introduces API updates for subscription selling plans support within Shopify POS.

New Cart API Methods

Adding Selling Plans

To add a selling plan to a line item in the cart, use the following method:

shopify.cart.addLineItemSellingPlan({
  lineItemUuid: 'line-item-uuid',
  sellingPlanId: 123456,
  sellingPlanName: 'Monthly Subscription - 10% off'
});

Removing Selling Plans

To remove a selling plan from a line item, use this method:

shopify.cart.removeLineItemSellingPlan('line-item-uuid');

API References

For detailed information on these methods, refer to the following documentation:

  • addLineItemSellingPlan
  • removeLineItemSellingPlan

Enhanced Line Item Interface

The LineItem interface has been enhanced to support selling plans:

interface LineItem {
  uuid: string;
  productId: number;
  requiresSellingPlan?: boolean;  // Indicates if a product must have a selling plan
  hasSellingPlanGroups?: boolean; // Indicates if a product has available selling plans
  sellingPlan?: SellingPlan;      // The currently applied selling plan
}

Version Requirements

⚠️ Critical Compatibility Note

To utilize these features, ensure you are using:

  • POS UI Extension 2025-10 or later
  • Shopify POS 10.13+

Attempting to use selling plan APIs or fields in older versions will result in blocked checkouts. Ensure your system is updated to avoid disruptions.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: POS UI Extensions 2025-10にて、Shopify POSでサブスクリプション販売プランをサポートする新しいCart APIメソッドが追加されました。カート内の商品に対してセリングプランの追加・削除が可能になり、LineItemインターフェースも拡張されましたが、利用にはPOS UI Extension 2025-10以降とShopify POS 10.13以降が必須で、古いバージョンではチェックアウトがブロックされるため注意が必要です。

entries.title: View in-progress returns and cancel unfulfilled items in POS order details
entries.description:
POS staff now have enhanced visibility into return processes and better tools for managing unfulfilled orders. When viewing order details, staff can now see which items are currently involved in in-progress returns, providing clarity for customer service interactions.

A new dedicated flow also allows staff to cancel and refund unfulfilled items directly from the order view, streamlining operations and ensuring accurate inventory management. Enhanced timeline events now show exact fulfillment quantities and return statuses.

Learn more about processing returns in Shopify POS.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify POSの注文詳細画面で、返品処理中の商品を確認できるようになり、未フルフィルメントの商品をキャンセル・返金できる新しいフローが追加されました。タイムラインでは正確なフルフィルメント数量と返品ステータスが表示されるようになり、店舗スタッフの業務効率と在庫管理の精度が向上します。

entries.title: Country-specific HS code management for international selling
entries.description:
You can now enter country-specific Harmonized System (HS) codes for your products, giving you more control over customs classification and tariff calculations for each destination market. This lets you provide detailed codes beyond the standard 6 digits, ensuring tariffs are calculated accurately for every country you ship to.

If you use Managed Markets, you’ll see which HS codes Managed Markets has assigned for your market countries. Your codes and Managed Markets codes are kept separate, so you always know which rates and rules apply.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 国際販売において、各仕向地国ごとに異なるHS(Harmonized System)コードを設定できるようになりました。標準の6桁を超える詳細なコードを国別に登録することで、関税計算の精度が向上します。Managed Marketsを利用している場合は、自社設定のコードとManaged Marketsが割り当てたコードが分離され、どちらの税率やルールが適用されるか明確に確認できます。

entries.title: Fulfillment service callback url is now optional
entries.description:
As of the Admin API version 2026-01, the callbackUrl argument in the fulfillmentServiceCreate and fulfillmentServiceUpdate mutations is now optional.

If your app's fulfillment services do not have a callback URL but have either inventoryManagement or trackingSupport enabled, they will need to submit the information required by these features via the API.

  • For submitting tracking information and handling fulfillment requests, refer to our documentation on building for Fulfillment Services.
  • For managing inventory quantities, see our documentation on managing Inventory Quantities and States.

How will this change affect my app?

This is a non-breaking change. If your app currently provides a callbackUrl, it will continue to function as before. You now have the option to create or update services without a callbackUrl.

What do I need to do?

No action is required for existing apps.

For new apps, you can omit the callbackUrl argument when creating or updating fulfillment services if your operations do not depend on these callbacks.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin API バージョン 2026-01 から、fulfillmentServiceCreate と fulfillmentServiceUpdate ミューテーションの callbackUrl 引数がオプション（任意）になりました。既存のアプリは引き続き動作し、新しいアプリはコールバック URL が不要な場合は省略できるようになります。この変更は非破壊的変更のため、既存アプリへの対応は不要です。

entries.title: Improved AI image background editing in the file editor
entries.description:
We've added enhanced AI capabilities to image editing in the file editor so you can now prompt changes with greater flexibility. You can change scenes or update lighting by going to the Generate panel and simply prompting (like "change the background to a studio packshot style").

Learn more about using AI in the file editor in the Shopify Help Center

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: ファイルエディタのAI画像編集機能が強化され、より柔軟なプロンプト入力が可能になりました。「背景をスタジオ撮影風に変更」などのテキスト指示で、シーンの変更や照明の調整ができるようになります。「生成」パネルから簡単にアクセスして利用できます。

entries.title: New heatmap visualization and Weekly Sales Patterns report within Analytics
entries.description:
Heatmaps enable two-dimensional analysis to spot patterns like peak sales times across hours and days, or top product and channel combinations. Beyond time-based insights, you can explore sales by products and channels to quickly see your strongest combinations at a glance.

We also launched a Weekly Sales Patterns report, which displays net sales by hour of day and day of week.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify管理画面のアナリティクスに、ヒートマップ可視化機能と「週次売上パターン」レポートが追加されました。時間帯×曜日別の売上ピークや、商品×販売チャネルの組み合わせなど、2次元での売上分析が可能になり、効果的な販売戦略の立案に役立ちます。

entries.title: Bulk operations group objects default changed to `false`
entries.description:
We have optimized the output of bulk operations in the GraphQL Admin API to enhance speed and reliability.

What's Changed

Bulk Queries (bulkOperationRunQuery)

The groupObjects argument now defaults to false. Grouping objects can slow down operations and increase failure rates, especially with large datasets.

Bulk Mutations (bulkOperationRunMutation)

The groupObjects argument is now deprecated. It does not affect the order of output files because mutation outputs do not have parent objects.

What You Need to Do

If You're Running Bulk Queries

  • To maintain grouped output: Set groupObjects: true.

    mutation {
  bulkOperationRunQuery(
    query: """
    {
      products {
        edges {
          node {
            id
            title
          }
        }
      }
    }
    """
    groupObjects: true  // Add this to maintain grouped output
  ) {
    bulkOperation {
      id
      status
    }
    userErrors {
      field
      message
    }
  }
}

If You're Running Bulk Mutations

Remove the groupObjects argument from your queries. This will not impact the output files.

Why We Made This Change

Most applications do not require grouped output and the associated overhead negatively impacts performance. These changes deliver faster, more predictable results that are easier to process at scale. Enable groupObjects only if your application specifically depends on the grouped output format. As this was the default behavior previously, you can verify on any version after 2025-07 by setting groupObjects to false and testing your application.

For optimal performance, omit groupObjects on or after 2026-01, and disable this option if you are on 2025-07 or 2025-10.

Learn More

  • Bulk Operations Queries Guide
  • Bulk Operations Imports Guide
  • Working with JSONL Output

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: GraphQL Admin APIのバルク操作において、2026-01バージョンから`groupObjects`引数のデフォルト値が`false`に変更されます。この変更により処理速度と信頼性が向上しますが、グループ化された出力形式が必要な場合は明示的に`groupObjects: true`を指定する必要があります。バルクミューテーションでは`groupObjects`引数が非推奨となり、削除を推奨されています。

entries.title: Integrate accelerated checkout buttons (Shop Pay and Apple Pay) on mobile app storefronts
entries.description: Add Shop Pay and Apple Pay checkout buttons to product and cart pages using Checkout Kit for Swift or React Native. Give customers the quick payment options they expect, with just a few lines of code.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: モバイルアプリストアフロント向けに、Checkout KitでShop PayとApple Payの高速チェックアウトボタンを商品ページやカートページに統合できるようになりました。SwiftまたはReact Nativeを使用して、わずか数行のコードで顧客が期待する迅速な決済オプションを提供できます。

entries.title: Shopify Duties and Import Taxes: USA postal tariff rate support
entries.description:
Duties and import taxes now support a new option for postal tariff rate calculations for orders shipping into the United States.

Previously, tariff rates for parcels using commercial and postal carriers were the same. As such, for packages shipping into the United States, the Shopify duties and import tax calculator calculates duties based on individual Harmonized System Code and Country of Origin information applied to your products. This calculation scheme is used by US Customs for commercial carriers, and is the default option.

Now, with our new setting, merchants have the option to modify duties calculation towards postal tariff rates. When on, duty calculations are calculated Ad Valorem based on the Country Code of Origin of your products. This calculation scheme is appropriate if you ship with a postal carrier, like Canada Post.
