This new setting applies to all international checkouts with United States as the destination, regardless of available shipping options.

To toggle the feature, visit your admin’s duty settings and click the box next to “Use postal duty rates into the United States”.

For more information on Shopify Duties and Import Taxes, please see the help center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopifyの関税・輸入税機能に、アメリカ向け配送における郵便関税率の計算オプションが追加されました。従来は商業運送業者向けの関税率(HSコードベース)のみでしたが、Canada Postなどの郵便事業者を利用する場合は、原産国コードに基づくAd Valorem方式での関税計算に切り替えられるようになりました。管理画面の関税設定から「Use postal duty rates into the United States」オプションを有効化することで利用可能です。

entries.title: Integrate accelerated checkout buttons (Shop Pay and Apple Pay) on your mobile app storefronts
entries.description: Add Shop Pay and Apple Pay checkout buttons to product and cart pages using Checkout Kit for Swift or React Native. Give customers the quick payment options they expect, with just a few lines of code.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: モバイルアプリストアフロント向けに、Shop PayとApple Payの高速チェックアウトボタンを統合できるようになりました。Checkout Kit for SwiftまたはReact Nativeを使用することで、わずか数行のコードで商品ページやカートページに決済ボタンを追加し、顧客に素早い支払いオプションを提供できます。

entries.title: Minute-level fine-grained control for Shopify Analytics
entries.description:
You can now better monitor time-sensitive events like product drops, flash sales, and promotional campaigns with minute-level control for Shopify Analytics. We now have finer time-grain selection and clearer partial interval treatment for you to monitor up-to-the-minute data.

Updates include:
* New quick-pick time ranges
* Advanced date picker with fine grain time inputs
* Visual patterns that clearly distinguish incomplete data periods from complete ones
* New "last refreshed" timestamps that show exactly when your data was updated.

The new time controls let you select custom ranges or quickly select "Last 30 minutes" or "Last 12 hours" to see live visual indicators showing when data is actively updating.

Learn more about using time controls and real-time data monitoring in the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Analyticsに分単位の時間制御機能が追加され、商品ドロップやフラッシュセール、プロモーションキャンペーンなどのリアルタイムモニタリングが可能になりました。「直近30分」「直近12時間」などのクイック選択、詳細な時刻入力、データ更新状況を示すビジュアルインジケーターなどが利用できます。時間に敏感なイベントの効果測定や即座の意思決定に役立つ機能強化です。

entries.title: Turn business questions into analytics reports with Sidekick
entries.description:
The analytics query editor now integrates with Sidekick and understands natural language, making advanced reporting accessible to everyone. Create and customize analytics reports by asking questions like "What was the best converting traffic source in September?" and Sidekick will build reports for you instantly.

Refine your queries with follow-up questions like "How many repeat versus new customers for each traffic source?" that build on your conversation history for more sophisticated insights. Sidekick remembers your conversation, so you can reference previous chats to dive deeper.

You can still write ShopifyQL directly, but now you can start with plain language and learn query building through practical examples. Sidekick translates your questions into ShopifyQL with business friendly explanations of what each report measures.

Get started: Create a "New Exploration" in Analytics or open any saved report to start asking questions.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopifyのアナリティクス機能にSidekickが統合され、自然言語での質問によってレポートを自動生成できるようになりました。「9月に最もコンバージョン率が高かったトラフィックソースは?」などの日常的な質問をするだけで、ShopifyQLを学ばなくても高度な分析レポートを作成できます。会話履歴を記憶し、追加質問で分析を深掘りすることも可能です。

entries.title: Flow adopts version 2025-10 of the GraphQL Admin API
entries.description:
Flow now uses version 2025-10 of the GraphQL Admin API, which includes new options for building automations. Flow can now access more detailed order, inventory, and payment information, letting you create workflows that respond to specific business conditions such as order totals and shipping dates.

Some of changes in version 2025-10 of the GraphQL Admin API include:

  • Orders query now supports current_total_price and total_weight filters and CURRENT_TOTAL_PRICE as a sortKey in Get order data actions. You can filter orders by total price and weight to create different fulfillment processes for high-value orders or heavy shipments. (Developer changelog)
  • New fields for inventory shipment timestamps including dateCreated, dateReceived, and dateShipped. You can track inventory shipment dates and set up alerts when inventory is created, received, or shipped to manage stock levels. (Developer changelog)
  • New fields for PaymentSchedule including balanceDue, totalBalance, and due. You can monitor payment schedules and automate reminders to follow-up based on balance due and payment status. (Developer changelog)
  • Rerouting fulfillment orders is now possible with the fulfillmentOrdersReroute mutation. You can redirect orders to different locations based on your business rules. (Developer changelog)
  • Some mutations now validate inventoryQuantities limits, including productSet, productVariantsBulkCreate, and productVariantsBulkUpdate (Developer changelog, Developer changelog)

For more information about how Flow uses the GraphQL, visit the documentation. To learn more about changes introduced in version 2025-10, visit the Developer changelog.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify FlowがGraphQL Admin APIのバージョン2025-10に対応し、より詳細な注文、在庫、決済情報にアクセスできるようになりました。注文合計金額や重量でのフィルタリング、在庫入荷日の追跡、支払いスケジュールの監視、フルフィルメント注文の経路変更など、ビジネス条件に応じたワークフロー自動化の選択肢が大幅に拡充されました。Flowを活用しているマーチャントやパートナーは、これらの新機能を使ってより高度な業務自動化が可能になります。

entries.title: Deprecate delivery legacy modes fields
entries.description:
Support for legacy mode profiles in shipping has been discontinued. This feature has been disabled for awhile, and the the Admin API is being updated to reflect this.

The following fields are being marked as deprecated:

  • DeliveryProfile.legacyMode

The following fields are effectively deprecated as they are no longer functional:

  • DeliverySetting.legacyModeBlocked
  • DeliverySetting.legacyModeProfiles
  • DeliverySettingInput.legacyModeProfiles

Note: These 3 fields cannot be marked as deprecated because that would leave their objects with zero public fields, which is known to cause problems for schema generation.

The corresponding queries that use these fields will now return static data that users should ignore. Any mutations that pass these fields will now be no-ops.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 配送設定のレガシーモードプロファイル機能のサポートが終了し、Admin GraphQL APIの関連フィールドが非推奨化されます。DeliveryProfile.legacyModeフィールドが非推奨となり、DeliverySetting関連の3つのフィールドは実質的に機能停止となります。これらのフィールドを使用するクエリは静的データを返し、ミューテーションは無効化されます。

entries.title: Customers can securely update email addresses in their accounts
entries.description:
Customers can now update their email addresses directly in their customer account profile, reducing the manual work you handle for email changes. When customers edit their email, they'll verify ownership through a secure one-time password sent to their new address, and they'll stay signed in throughout the process.

Available now for merchants using new customer accounts through the customer profile section.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 新しいカスタマーアカウントを利用している場合、顧客が自分のアカウントプロフィールから直接メールアドレスを変更できるようになりました。変更時には新しいメールアドレスにワンタイムパスワードが送信され、本人確認が行われるため安全性も確保されています。この機能により、マーチャントがメールアドレス変更を手動で対応する手間が削減されます。

entries.title: Export user data in bulk for audits and compliance
entries.description:
Get all your user management data in one go. Export users, roles, groups, and user activity logs in bulk directly from Admin to CSV files for security audits and compliance reporting.

What you can export in bulk:

  • Users with role, group, and store assignments
  • Roles with detailed permissions
  • Groups with role and store assignments
  • User activity logs with event types and details

The Export button appears on the following pages in Shopify Admin under Settings:

  • Users
  • Users > Roles
  • Users > Groups (Plus plan)
  • Users > Security > User activity logs

This feature is available to owners and administrators of merchants on all plans. Learn more about the columns included in each export in Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify管理画面から、ユーザー、ロール、グループ、ユーザーアクティビティログをCSV形式で一括エクスポートできる機能が追加されました。セキュリティ監査やコンプライアンス報告に必要なユーザー管理データを簡単に取得できるようになり、全プランのオーナーと管理者が利用可能です。

entries.title: Save and share your best Sidekick prompts as skills
entries.description:
You can now save your most useful Sidekick prompts as custom skills and reuse them whenever you need them. If you regularly ask Sidekick for yesterday's sales by product, a specific customer segment, or product descriptions in your brand voice, you can turn those prompts into shortcuts.

Creating skills: Type / in Sidekick and select "Create new skill." You can also turn any message you want to reuse into a skill by clicking the action button on that message. Give your skill a shortcut name like yesterday-sales or product-description. You can manage up to 25 skills.

Using and sharing skills: Access your skills anytime by typing / followed by your shortcut. Share skills with teammates or other merchants using a URL link. When someone clicks the link, they can review the skill and add it to their own collection. All shared skills go through safety checks to ensure they are secure.

Skills work well for tasks you do regularly, whether that's pulling specific reports, creating customer segments, writing content that matches your brand voice, or analyzing sales patterns. One team member might create a skill for weekly sales reporting, another for product descriptions that match your brand, and everyone can share and use them.

Learn more about using Sidekick skills in the Shopify Help Center

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Sidekickで頻繁に使用するプロンプトをカスタムスキルとして保存し、ショートカットで再利用できるようになりました。昨日の売上レポートや商品説明文の作成など、定型的なタスクをスキル化して最大25個まで管理でき、URLでチームメンバーや他のマーチャントと共有することも可能です。

entries.title: Unit pricing is now available globally
entries.description:
You can now display how much products cost per unit of measurement, helping customers make informed purchasing decisions by showing:

  • Price per weight (e.g. gram, ounce)
  • Price per volume (e.g. liter, gallon)
  • Price per length (e.g. meter, foot)
  • Price per quantity (item count)

For example:
- $10.49/oz or $5.32/ft
- $2.99 each

Learn more about unit pricing.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 商品の単位あたりの価格表示機能がグローバルで利用可能になりました。重量（グラム、オンス）、容量（リットル、ガロン）、長さ（メートル、フィート）、数量ごとの価格を表示でき、顧客が購入判断をしやすくなります。例えば「$10.49/oz」や「$2.99 each」といった表示が可能です。

entries.title: Flow: New triggers for discounts, disputes, and fulfillment order splits
entries.description:
Four new triggers in Shopify Flow help you stay on top of your shop. You can now build workflows that respond when automatic discounts are created, discount codes are generated, Shopify Payments disputes are submitted, or fulfillment orders are split.

  • Automated discount created starts a workflow when an automatic discount is created by you or by a third-party app in your store.
  • Discount code created starts a workflow when a discount code is created by you or by a third-party app in your store.
  • Dispute created starts a workflow when a chargeback or inquiry dispute is created for an order in your store that uses Shopify Payments.
  • Fulfillment order split starts a workflow when a fulfillment order is split by you or by a third-party app and returns the original fulfillment order as well as fulfillment orders resulting from the split.

These triggers give you instant visibility into promotional activity and payment issues, whether they're created by you or third-party apps. Use them to send Slack notifications when disputes arise, automatically tag orders that use specific discount types, or coordinate with fulfillment partners when orders are divided.

Each trigger provides detailed data about the event, so you can create precise conditions and actions in your workflows. Find these new triggers in the Flow app under your Shopify admin, and start building automated responses to keep your operations running smoothly.

For more information about building templates, visit the documentation. For questions and feedback, visit the Shopify community.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Flowに4つの新しいトリガーが追加されました。自動ディスカウントの作成、ディスカウントコードの生成、Shopify Paymentsの支払い紛争の発生、フルフィルメント注文の分割時にワークフローを自動実行できるようになり、プロモーション活動の可視化や支払い問題への即時対応が可能になります。これらのトリガーを使用して、Slack通知の送信、注文の自動タグ付け、フルフィルメントパートナーとの連携などの自動化が実現できます。

entries.title: Merchants can now dispute Balance card or Shopify credit card transactions in their account
entries.description:
Previously, you could only submit disputes for fraudulent transactions in your Shopify account. For other dispute reasons, you had to reach out to Shopify support.

Now you can dispute for many reasons directly in your Shopify account. The new experience lets you select the transaction, choose your dispute reason, and upload supporting evidence—all in one flow.

This allows you to:
1. Submit disputes immediately on your own schedule
2. Follow guided steps with evidence requirements specific to your dispute reason
3. Track dispute status directly in your account

The feature is available for all merchants with Shopify Balance or Credit cards.

Learn more about Shopify Credit disputes or Shopify Balance disputes in the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify BalanceカードまたはShopify Creditカードの取引について、マーチャントが管理画面から直接異議申し立てを行えるようになりました。以前は不正取引のみ対応可能でしたが、現在は様々な理由での異議申し立てが可能となり、証拠書類のアップロードや進捗状況の確認も一つの画面で完結できます。この機能はShopify BalanceまたはCreditカードを持つ全てのマーチャントが利用可能です。

entries.title: Increased Shopify Credit rewards cap
entries.description:
Shopify Credit cardholders can now earn 3% cashback on their top spend category for up to $250,000 USD in eligible purchases each account year (up from $100,000 USD). After reaching $250,000 in your top spending category, you'll continue to earn 1% cashback on eligible purchases for the rest of your account year. You’ll still earn 1% cashback in all other rewardable spend categories.

Learn more about Shopify Credit rewards and how cashback is calculated in the Shopify Help Center.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Creditカード保有者が最も利用額の多いカテゴリーで3%のキャッシュバックを獲得できる上限額が、年間10万ドルから25万ドルに引き上げられました。上限到達後も、その会計年度内は1%のキャッシュバックが継続されます。

entries.title: Themes now use one industry tag for better search results
entries.description:
The Theme Store has simplified its categorization process by assigning only one industry tag per theme, effective immediately. As a result, all secondary industry tags have been automatically removed.

Your theme's primary industry tag now serves as its sole industry classification. Choose the industry that best matches:

  • The main product types showcased in your demo store
  • Your intended target merchant audience

This will make it easier for merchants to browse and find themes tailored to their specific industry needs.

You can review your current primary industry tag in the Partner Dashboard.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Theme Storeのカテゴリー分類が簡素化され、各テーマに割り当てられる業種タグが1つのみになりました。副次的な業種タグは自動的に削除され、主要な業種タグのみがテーマの分類として使用されます。この変更により、マーチャントが自分の業種に合ったテーマを見つけやすくなります。

entries.title: Shopify.dev MCP Now Supports More APIs
entries.description:
The Shopify.dev MCP server now supports code generation for a range of powerful APIs, enhancing your development experience:

  • Storefront API
  • Partner API
  • Customer Account API
  • Payment Apps API
  • Polaris Web Components
  • Liquid

This update allows you to leverage the Shopify.dev MCP as a virtual pair programmer within your preferred IDE. Generate code snippets, explore API capabilities, and accelerate your development process across the Shopify platform.

Get started:
To begin, configure the Shopify.dev MCP server to integrate it with your development environment and unlock these new capabilities.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify.dev MCPサーバーが、Storefront API、Partner API、Customer Account API、Payment Apps API、Polaris、Liquidなど、より多くのAPIのコード生成に対応しました。開発者は好みのIDE内でMCPを仮想ペアプログラマーとして活用し、コードスニペットの生成やAPI機能の探索が可能になり、開発プロセスが加速されます。

entries.title: Rerouting Fulfillment Orders is now possible via API
entries.description:
We have introduced the fulfillmentOrdersReroute mutation to the Admin GraphQL API. This mutation allows you to move fulfillment orders to the next best location based on the shop’s delivery strategies. This update ensures that both the API and Admin offer the same capabilities, enhancing consistency and flexibility for developers.

With this mutation, you can optionally specify locations to exclude from the reroute. Alternatively, you can define a set of locations to consider for changing the fulfillment orders’ location.

mutation {
  fulfillmentOrdersReroute(
    fulfillmentOrderIds: ["gid://shopify/FulfillmentOrder/12345678"],
    excludedLocationIds: ["gid://shopify/Location/456789"]
  ) {
    movedFulfillmentOrders {
      # FulfillmentOrder fields
    }
    userErrors {
      field
      message
    }
  }
}

For further details on working with the new mutation, please refer to our documentation.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin GraphQL APIに新しく`fulfillmentOrdersReroute`ミューテーションが追加されました。このAPIを使用することで、ショップの配送戦略に基づいて、フルフィルメント注文を次に最適なロケーションに自動的に再割り当てできるようになります。特定のロケーションを除外したり、対象ロケーションを指定したりすることも可能で、管理画面と同等の機能がAPIでも利用できるようになりました。

entries.title: `InventoryShipmentReceive` mutation now supports idempotency
entries.description:
InventoryShipmentReceive mutation now requires an idempotency key

The inventoryShipmentReceive mutation now requires an idempotencyKey field that prevents duplicate shipment receiving operations. You must provide an idempotency key with every request to ensure that repeated requests with the same key won't create duplicate inventory adjustments, helping you avoid accidental over-receiving of shipment items.

Key benefits:

  • Prevents duplicate inventory adjustments from network retries or multiple submissions.
  • Ensures consistent inventory levels even when mutation requests are repeated.
  • Maintains data integrity during shipment receiving workflows.

Breaking change:

The idempotencyKey field is now required for all inventoryShipmentReceive mutations.

Usage:

mutation inventoryShipmentReceive($input: InventoryShipmentReceiveInput!) {
  inventoryShipmentReceive(
    id: "gid://shopify/InventoryShipment/123"
    idempotencyKey: "0199150a-0776-7c59-b03a-c7bafe3f4dfc"
    lineItems: [
      {
        shipmentLineItemId: "gid://shopify/InventoryShipmentLineItem/789"
        quantity: 10
        reason: ACCEPTED
      }
    ]
  ) {
    inventoryShipment {
      id
    }
    userErrors {
      field
      message
    }
  }
}

The idempotency key must be unique per receiving operation and can be any string up to 255 characters. We recommend using UUID v7 for idempotency keys, as they provide guaranteed uniqueness and include timestamp information for better traceability.

Important:

Idempotency keys are cleared periodically to maintain system performance, so the same key can be reused after some time. However, you should always generate fresh keys for new operations to ensure proper idempotency protection.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin GraphQL APIの`inventoryShipmentReceive`ミューテーションで、`idempotencyKey`フィールドが必須化されました。この変更により、ネットワークリトライや複数送信による在庫調整の重複を防ぎ、出荷受領処理におけるデータ整合性を保証します。2026-01バージョンからの破壊的変更のため、このミューテーションを使用しているアプリやシステムは必ず対応が必要です。

entries.title: Subscription contract shipping requirements now sync with product variants
entries.description:
We've improved how subscription contracts handle shipping requirements to ensure accurate tax calculations, delivery details, and order totals. These changes apply when using the subscriptionBillingAttemptCreate mutation.

What's Changed

Shipping requirements use latest product information
Subscription contracts now dynamically retrieve the "requires shipping" value from the product variant for each contract line. Previously, a static value was stored when the subscription line was added to the contract. This update ensures that shipping requirements are always current when you update your product variants. This change also applies to SubscriptionDraft.fields.deliveryOptions.

Delivery lines added only when necessary
If no lines in a subscription contract require shipping, then we no longer add a delivery line to the order. This prevents unnecessary shipping charges and ensures correct tax calculations.

Impact

These changes ensure that:

  • Taxes are calculated correctly based on current shipping requirements.
  • Order totals reflect accurate delivery costs.
  • Shipping configuration issues are caught before orders are processed.
  • Subscription contracts stay in sync with your product catalog changes.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: サブスクリプション契約の配送要件が、商品バリアントの最新情報と動的に同期されるようになりました。これにより、バリアントの「配送が必要」設定を変更した際に、税金計算や配送料が正確に反映され、配送不要な商品のみの契約では配送ラインが追加されなくなります。subscriptionBillingAttemptCreate mutationを使用する際に適用される破壊的変更です。

entries.title: Deprecation of legacy return APIs and improvements to return management
entries.description:
We're introducing important changes to simplify and enhance return management in the Shopify Admin API.

What's changing?

  • The returnRefund mutation is deprecated and replaced by the new returnProcess mutation. The returnProcess mutation streamlines return lifecycle management by combining disposition decisions and financial processing into a single call.
  • The field Return.suggestedReturnRefund is deprecated in favor of the new Return.suggestedFinancialOutcome field.
  • Exchange fulfillment orders are now created only when exchange line items are processed, ensuring accuracy.
  • Refunds and return processing now offer enhanced precision for managing returned line items.

Action required:
If your app currently creates returns using returnCreate or approves return requests using returnApproveRequest, migrate to the new returnProcess mutation to handle refunds and exchanges. The older mutations (refundCreate, returnRefund) and the query field (Return.suggestedRefund) are deprecated. Instead, you should now use returnProcess and Return.suggestedFinancialOutcome.

Availability:
These new APIs are available now in the unstable API version and officially launch in API version 2025-07.

For more details, see our updated migration guide.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Admin APIの返品管理機能が大幅に改善され、従来の返品・返金関連APIが非推奨となります。返品処理を行うアプリは、新しい`returnProcess`ミューテーションへの移行が必要で、これにより返品のライフサイクル管理が単一の呼び出しで完結するようになります。2025-07 APIバージョンで正式リリースされ、現在はunstableバージョンで利用可能です。

entries.title: Pay-in-Full credit card payment option will automatically retry each month
entries.description: We’ve added automatic monthly retries to the Pay-in-full credit card payment option because this respects the merchants original choice. Now merchants can choose the Pay-in-Full payment option and that will not be disabled in case of payment failure. This enables merchants to repay their statements faster allowing them to save on fees and have extra spend capacity.

claude-sonnet-4-5.titleJa: 全額払いのクレジットカード決済オプションは毎月自動的に再試行されます
claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Shopify Creditの一括払いオプションで、決済が失敗した場合でも毎月自動的に再試行されるようになりました。これにより、マーチャントは当初選択した一括払いが無効化されることなく、手数料を節約し、利用可能枠を早期に回復できるようになります。

entries.title: Polaris unified web components are now stable
entries.description:
Polaris web components are now generally available for extensions with version 2025-10. This unified toolkit now includes support for POS, Admin, Checkout, and Customer Accounts, and is always up-to-date through Shopify's CDN.

Since early access, we've added 14 new components for App Home, including a new modal experience. Additionally, there are 36 new components for Checkout and Customer Accounts, and a new Point of Sale surface with 31 components.

To get started, check out the developer documentation, or learn more about the library by reading our blog post.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Polarisウェブコンポーネントがバージョン2025-10で正式版となり、POS、Admin、Checkout、Customer Accountsに対応した統一ツールキットとして利用可能になりました。早期アクセス版以降、App Home向けに14個、CheckoutとCustomer Accounts向けに36個、POSサーフェス向けに31個の新コンポーネントが追加され、ShopifyのCDNを通じて常に最新の状態で提供されます。アプリ開発者は統一されたコンポーネントライブラリを使用して、より効率的に複数のShopifyサーフェスに対応したアプリを構築できるようになります。

entries.title: New `productNetwork` field on the `Order` object
entries.description: We're adding a productNetwork Boolean field on the GraphQL Admin API's Order object in version 2025-10. This field indicates whether a customer also purchased items from other stores.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: GraphQL Admin APIの`Order`オブジェクトに新しい`productNetwork`というBoolean型フィールドが2025-10バージョンで追加されます。このフィールドは、顧客が複数のストアから商品を購入したかどうかを示すものです。複数店舗にまたがる購入行動を分析できるようになります。

entries.title: Control when B2B orders require review at checkout
entries.description: You can now dynamically determine which B2B orders require review using the Payment Customization Function. The new orderReviewAdd operation lets you define custom business rules to automatically send orders to draft for review based on conditions like order value, cart contents, or customer attributes. Use the Payment Customization Function API to implement complex B2B workflows such as requiring review for high-value orders, pre-order items, or new customer orders - giving you granular control over order validation beyond the static all-or-nothing setting. This operation is only available for B2B purchases on stores with the Plus plan.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: B2B注文のチェックアウト時に承認が必要かどうかを動的に制御できる新機能が追加されました。Payment Customization Function APIを使用して、注文金額、カート内容、顧客属性などの条件に基づいて、特定の注文を下書きステータスにして承認プロセスに回すビジネスルールを定義できます。この機能はPlusプランのストアでのみ利用可能です。

entries.title: Dynamic complexity cost for `productSet` mutation
entries.description:
The productSet mutation mutation now uses dynamic complexity costing that more accurately reflects the actual computational cost of operations.

What's changing

Instead of a fixed cost of 50 points for all productSet operations, the mutation now calculates complexity based on the actual work being performed:

  • Base cost: 10 points
  • Per variant: 0.2 points
  • Per variant file: 0.6 points
  • Per variant metafield: 0.4 points
  • Per product metafield: 0.4 points
  • Per product file: 1.9 points

The total complexity is calculated as:

10 +
  (variants × 0.2) +
	(variant_files × 0.6) +
	(variant_metafields × 0.4) 
	(product_metafields × 0.4) 
	(product_files × 1.9)

Benefits for your apps

Lower costs for most operations: More than 99.5% of existing productSet operations will cost less than the previous fixed cost of 50 points. Simple product updates that previously cost 50 points now cost as little as 10-20 points.

Support for larger products: The mutation now supports products with up to 2,048 variants for merchants on all plans, a significant increase from the previous limit of 100 variants. This enables apps to manage more complex products and support merchants with diverse business needs.

Examples

Simple product update (1 variant, no files or metafields):

  • Previous cost: 50 points
  • New cost: 10 points (80% reduction)

Medium complexity (20 variants, 5 product metafields):

  • Previous cost: 50 points
  • New cost: 16 points (68% reduction)

Complex product (200 variants, 10 files, 20 metafields):

  • Previous cost: 50 points
  • New cost: 77 points (reflects actual resource usage)

Migration guidance

For most apps, no changes are required. Your existing productSet operations will automatically benefit from lower complexity costs.

For apps working with high-complexity products exceeding the 1000-point single query limit:

  • Consider using bulk mutations for very large operations
  • Split complex operations into separate calls: use productSet for core product data, then use metafieldsSet and fileCreate for additional data

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: Admin GraphQL APIの`productSet`ミューテーションの複雑度コストが、固定50ポイントから動的計算方式に変更されました。99.5%以上の操作でコストが削減され、シンプルな商品更新は10ポイント程度になる一方、すべてのプランで最大2,048バリアントまでサポート可能になりました。ほとんどのアプリは変更不要で自動的に恩恵を受けますが、非常に複雑な商品を扱う場合はバルクミューテーションの利用や操作の分割を検討する必要があります。

entries.title: ShopifyQL now available as `shopifyqlQuery` within the GraphQL Admin API
entries.description:
Developers can now leverage ShopifyQL to extract valuable insights from all merchant analytics including sales, customer, and product data via the GraphQL Admin API. This enhancement allows for more sophisticated data analysis and reporting.

For a comprehensive guide on the ShopifyQL language, please visit the ShopifyQL syntax documentation.

The shopifyqlQuery field is now accessible on the QueryRoot of the GraphQL Admin API. To learn more about using this new query field, refer to our detailed documentation.

For example, here is a query that demonstrates how to retrieve total sales data, grouped by month, starting from the beginning of the current year: 

{
   shopifyqlQuery(query: "FROM sales SHOW total_sales GROUP BY month SINCE startOfYear(0y) ORDER BY month") {
    tableData {
      columns {
        name
        dataType
        displayName
      }
      rows
    }
    parseErrors
  }
}

The response contains table data with column and row values, detailing the total sales per month. 

{
  "data": {
    "shopifyqlQuery": {
      "tableData": {
        "columns": [
          {
            "name": "month",
            "dataType": "MONTH_TIMESTAMP",
            "displayName": "Month"
          },
          {
            "name": "total_sales",
            "dataType": "MONEY",
            "displayName": "Total sales"
          }
        ],
        "rows": [
          {
            "month": "2025-01-01",
            "total_sales": "5542.954"
          },
          {
            "month": "2025-02-01",
            "total_sales": "1610.094"
          }
        ]
      },
      "parseErrors": []
    }
  }
}

Any parsing errors encountered during execution will be listed under parseErrors.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: GraphQL Admin APIにShopifyQLクエリ機能が追加され、売上、顧客、商品などのマーチャント分析データをより高度に抽出・分析できるようになりました。新しい`shopifyqlQuery`フィールドを使用することで、月別売上集計など複雑なデータレポートをAPI経由で取得可能になります。開発者は既存のShopifyQL構文を活用して、カスタムダッシュボードや分析ツールを構築できます。

entries.title: Duplicate themes with the Admin GraphQL API
entries.description:
Starting in version 2025-10, the GraphQL Admin API includes a themeDuplicate mutation to duplicate store themes. The mutation accepts a theme ID and an optional name parameter to rename the duplicated theme.

For further details, refer to the themeDuplicate reference documentation.

claude-sonnet-4-5.summarizedJa: 2025-10バージョンから、GraphQL Admin APIに`themeDuplicate`ミューテーションが追加されました。この機能により、ストアのテーマをプログラムで複製できるようになり、テーマIDと任意のテーマ名を指定することが可能です。開発者やパートナーがテーマ管理ツールやアプリを構築する際に活用できる新機能です。
